StringTable.String: Attacking us would be a fatal mistake.

StringTable.Label: GENERAL_CONVERSATION_ACCEPT_Option14_20
StringTable.String: Our toughness is not immediately noticeable, but it should not be underestimated.

StringTable.Label: GENERAL_CONVERSATION_ACCEPT_Option14_21
StringTable.String: Any hostile actions towards us would result in dire consequences.

StringTable.Label: GENERAL_CONVERSATION_ACCEPT_Option15_0
StringTable.String: According to the pamphlets, ascension means hanging out with lions and lambs and tables of fruit.

StringTable.Label: GENERAL_CONVERSATION_ACCEPT_Option16_0
StringTable.String: Ah, that. Well, everyone knows that ginger and chocolate are the most powerful things in the universe.

StringTable.Label: GENERAL_CONVERSATION_ACCEPT_Option16_1
StringTable.String: We cannot help that people are interested in the wonderful products of MetaAppleDisneyGooglePlus.

StringTable.Label: GENERAL_CONVERSATION_ACCEPT_Option17_0
StringTable.String: You biologics need to be educated on the superiority of machines.

StringTable.Label: GENERAL_CONVERSATION_ACCEPT_Option18_0
StringTable.String: Well, to be honest, I had hoped you wouldn't notice...

StringTable.Label: GENERAL_CONVERSATION_ACCEPT_Option18_1
StringTable.String: I understand. It's just that our culture is so wonderful.

StringTable.Label: GENERAL_CONVERSATION_ACCEPT_Option19_0
StringTable.String: You clearly have never tasted chocolate.

StringTable.Label: GENERAL_CONVERSATION_ACCEPT_Option20_0
StringTable.String: Huh?

StringTable.Label: GENERAL_CONVERSATION_ACCEPT_Option20_1
StringTable.String: I have no idea what was just said.

StringTable.Label: GENERAL_CONVERSATION_ACCEPT_Option21_0
StringTable.String: This is a PG rated discussion. In other words, probably best not to explore the details.

StringTable.Label: GENERAL_CONVERSATION_ACCEPT_Option22_0
StringTable.String: We shall see.

StringTable.Label: GENERAL_CONVERSATION_ACCEPT_Option22_1
StringTable.String: Acknowledged.

StringTable.Label: GENERAL_CONVERSATION_ACCEPT_Option23_0
StringTable.String: Acknowledged.

StringTable.Label: GENERAL_CONVERSATION_ACCEPT_Option23_1
StringTable.String: Understood.

StringTable.Label: GENERAL_CONVERSATION_ACCEPT_Option23_2
StringTable.String: We will take what you have said under advisement.

StringTable.Label: GENERAL_CONVERSATION_ACCEPT_Option23_3
StringTable.String: We understand.

StringTable.Label: GENERAL_CONVERSATION_ACCEPT_Option23_4
StringTable.String: We will take your message under advisement.

StringTable.Label: END_GAME_PARAGRAPH_CONQUEST_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Through your creative use of guns, ships and ships with guns, you have put your boot on the galaxy's neck. All of your enemies have been crushed, their planets beaten into submission, and their citizens made to wave your flag. It wasn't pretty, but it never had to be, did it?

StringTable.Label: END_GAME_PARAGRAPH_INFLUENCE_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Your culture has spread across the entire galaxy. Aliens everywhere are seeking to emulate the ways of your people, adding or removing limbs as necessary to better fit their vision of the perfect life you lead. Who needs to conquer their bodies when you already own their hearts and minds?

StringTable.Label: END_GAME_PARAGRAPH_RESEARCH_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Using your powerful brains, your culture has unlocked the secrets of not only this universe, but the one beyond. Let the simpletons of the galaxy squabble over the dust and fragments of rock they squat upon. For your people, something far greater beckons.

StringTable.Label: END_GAME_PARAGRAPH_ASCENSION_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Your study of the ways of the Precursors is complete, and your people will soon be indistinguishable from the Precursors themselves. Having mastered their technology and way of thinking, your people are about to set out on a journey that the lesser minds of this galaxy cannot even begin to comprehend.

StringTable.Label: END_GAME_PARAGRAPH_ASCENSION_DEFEAT_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Another race has followed the path of the Precursors and ascended. Though our destruction is not immediate, you have led us to become evolutionary obsolete. Our spaceships and lasers have little meaning to a race beyond mortality, to whom time and space are children's toys. To them, we aren't even truly sentient, we are dust blowing around the galaxy, ignored or destroyed as their whims dictate.

StringTable.Label: END_GAME_PARAGRAPH_ALLIANCE_Option0_0
StringTable.String: And with the stroke of a pen, peace was finally at hand. A peace that would last, for it had been laid on a foundation of mutual trust and respect. With their minds and resources no longer wasted on the unending thirst of war, a new golden age of prosperity soon descends upon your people and its allies.

StringTable.Label: END_GAME_PARAGRAPH_TURNLIMIT_Option0_0
StringTable.String: For years, your people fought and struggled on the galactic stage with your ambitious and conniving neighbors. Although no single race ever gained a decisive edge, when the conflict turned into a war of attrition, it was your people who ultimately ended in the best position.

StringTable.Label: END_GAME_PARAGRAPH_PRESTIGE_Option0_0
StringTable.String: For years, your people fought and struggled on the galactic stage with your ambitious and conniving neighbors. Although no single race ever gained a decisive edge, when the conflict turned into a war of attrition, it was your people who ultimately ended in the best position.

StringTable.Label: END_GAME_PARAGRAPH_UNITEDPLANETS_Option0_0
StringTable.String: You shouldn't be seeing this.

StringTable.Label: END_GAME_PARAGRAPH_DEFEAT_Option0_0
StringTable.String: And with that, your civilization collapsed. For a time, your people lived on, scattered around the galaxy as refugees and hermits. But your species' power never returned. Will your people be remembered in museums and textbooks, or wiped from the memories of all beings? You'll never know. It's not up to you to say anymore.

StringTable.Label: END_GAME_PARAGRAPH_RETIRED_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Building a galaxy spanning civilization takes a long time, and not everyone has the patience for it. Will your people understand that you did the best you could, or will they curse you for abandoning them while aliens devour their bones? Don't let it keep you up at night (you should let it keep you up at night).

StringTable.Label: STOLE_CREDITS_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Our Diplomat {OBJECTNAME} has stolen {AMOUNT:2} credits from the {PLAYERFACTION:3}

StringTable.Label: UNIT_STOLE_TECH_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Our Diplomat {OBJECTNAME} stole the {TECHNAME:2} technology from the {PLAYERFACTION:3}.

StringTable.Label: UNIT_STOLE_TECH_RESPONSE_OK_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Keep up the good work.

StringTable.Label: STOLE_TECH_Option0_0
StringTable.String: We've stolen the {TECHNAME:2} technology from the {PLAYERFACTION:3}.

StringTable.Label: STOLE_TECH_FAIL_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Our cosmic eye has gazed upon the {PLAYERFACTION:3}. Although no new technologies were observed, we have gathered some insights on research methods different from our own. [BR][BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight][ICON=Stat_Research_Icon] +25% Research Progress[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: STOLE_TECH_FAIL_NO_RESEARCH_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Our cosmic eye has gazed upon the {PLAYERFACTION:3}. No new technologies were observed, and we had no research project of our own to check against theirs.

StringTable.Label: STOLE_TECH_RESPONSE_OK_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Excellent.

StringTable.Label: STOLE_TECH_RESPONSE_OK_NO_RESEARCH_Option0_0
StringTable.String: How foolish of us.

StringTable.Label: GENERIC_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Fill Description

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_MAIN_Option239_0
StringTable.String: What foul pollutant of a creature crosses my screen?

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_RESPONSE_PEACEFUL_Option237_0
StringTable.String: It's nice to meet you and your kind, Korath.

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_RESPONSE_NEUTRAL_Option222_0
StringTable.String: Mind your manners, Korath. You won't intimidate anyone here.

StringTable.Label: GENERIC_GREETING_Option46_0
StringTable.String: Make this quick, alien scum.

StringTable.Label: DECLARE_WAR_MAIN_Option40_0
StringTable.String: How wretched a life you must live, not being one of us. Soon it will be over, for you and all your kind.

StringTable.Label: ASK_FOR_PEACE_MAIN_Option3_0
StringTable.String: You've proven your strength, alien. Enough with this fighting. Let us tend to our wounds.

StringTable.Label: AI_CREATED_TRADE_OFFER_Option22_0
StringTable.String: Look, alien. An offer and a gift. You'd be a fool not to accept.

StringTable.Label: TRADE_OFFER_ACCEPT_Option13_0
StringTable.String: We accept your offer, alien.

StringTable.Label: GENERAL_CONVERSATION_MAIN_Option56_0
StringTable.String: The galaxy is awash in filthy aliens. It's sickening.

StringTable.Label: GENERAL_CONVERSATION_MAIN_Option56_1
StringTable.String: Do you ever tire of the sounds your hideous face makes? I do.

StringTable.Label: GENERAL_CONVERSATION_MAIN_Option56_2
StringTable.String: Don't waste my time our yours with idle chatter. But mostly don't waste mine.

StringTable.Label: GENERAL_CONVERSATION_ACCEPT_Option24_0
StringTable.String: Nice to talk to you too, Korath.

StringTable.Label: GENERAL_CONVERSATION_ACCEPT_Option25_0
StringTable.String: You seem uglier than normal today.

StringTable.Label: ELECTION_WARNING_LOSE_Option0_0
StringTable.String: We are scheduled for an election in 5 months. Pollsters report that we are likely to [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]lose by a landslide[/COLOR].[BR][BR]Elections require that we watch our approval rating closely. Voters will not be easily swayed by short term measures and will consider their morale over a long period. All the things that increase approval will help us win elections like lowering the tax rate and building approval improvements. Or we can consider forms of government that don't hold elections. If we lose an election we will fall to a [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Coalition Government[/COLOR] which limits our power. Including blocking our ability to declare war.

StringTable.Label: ELECTION_WARNING_LOW_Option0_0
StringTable.String: We are scheduled for an election in 5 months. Pollsters report that we are likely to [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]lose, but it will be close[/COLOR]. We should focus on increasing morale.[BR][BR]Elections require that we watch our approval rating closely. Voters will not be easily swayed by short term measures and will consider their morale over a long period. All the things that increase approval will help us win elections like lowering the tax rate and building approval improvements. Or we can consider forms of government that don't hold elections. If we lose an election we will fall to a [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Coalition Government[/COLOR] which limits our power. Including blocking our ability to declare war.

StringTable.Label: ELECTION_WARNING_HIGH_Option0_0
StringTable.String: We are scheduled for an election in 5 months. Pollsters report that we are likely to [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]win, but it will be close[/COLOR]. We can't allow morale to drop.[BR][BR]Elections require that we watch our approval rating closely. Voters will not be easily swayed by short term measures and will consider their morale over a long period. All the things that increase approval will help us win elections like lowering the tax rate and building approval improvements. Or we can consider forms of government that don't hold elections. If we lose an election we will fall to a [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Coalition Government[/COLOR] which limits our power. Including blocking our ability to declare war.

StringTable.Label: ELECTION_WARNING_WIN_Option0_0
StringTable.String: We are scheduled for an election in 5 months. Pollsters report that we are likely to [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]win by a landslide[/COLOR].[BR][BR]Elections require that we watch our approval rating closely. Voters will not be easily swayed by short term measures and will consider their morale over a long period. All the things that increase approval will help us win elections like lowering the tax rate and building approval improvements. Or we can consider forms of government that don't hold elections. If we lose an election we will fall to a [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Coalition Government[/COLOR] which limits our power. Including blocking our ability to declare war.

StringTable.Label: ELECTION_WARNING_RESPONSE_ECONOMY_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Let's review our Economic options. [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](Opens Economy screen)[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: ELECTION_WARNING_RESPONSE_GOVERNMENT_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Let's review our Government options. [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](Opens Government screen)[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: ELECTION_WARNING_RESPONSE_WAIT_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Give me a moment.

StringTable.Label: COLONY_LIMIT_WARNING_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Our government is insufficient for the needs of our growing civilization. New colonies complain that the government only serves the homeworld and decisions across our worlds are becoming increasingly delayed by deeper and deeper levels of bureaucracy.[BR][BR]Governments are only effective at managing a certain number of worlds. After this [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Colony Limit[/COLOR] is exceeded we will suffer a Morale penalty for each Colony we control beyond this limit.

StringTable.Label: COLONY_LIMIT_WARNING_RESPONSE_GOVERNMENT_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Let's review our Government options. [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](Opens Government screen)[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: COLONY_LIMIT_WARNING_RESPONSE_WAIT_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Give me a moment.

StringTable.Label: COLONY_LIMIT_WARNING_TECH_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Our government is insufficient for the needs of our growing civilization. New colonies complain that the government only serves the homeworld and decisions across our worlds are becoming increasingly delayed by bureaucracy.[BR][BR]Governments are only effective at managing a certain number of worlds. After this [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Colony Limit[/COLOR] is exceeded we suffer a Morale penalty for each Colony beyond this limit. Unfortunately we haven't discovered any governments that increase our Colony Limit. We should discover technologies that allow more advanced forms of government, either by research or by trading with other civilizations.

StringTable.Label: COLONY_LIMIT_WARNING_TECH_RESPONSE_TECH_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Let's review our Research options. [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](Opens Research screen)[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: COLONY_LIMIT_WARNING_TECH_RESPONSE_WAIT_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Give me a moment.

StringTable.Label: CHOOSE_FIRST_GOVERNMENT_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Now that we have expanded beyond our homeworld, the colonists are crying out for structure. It is time for us to choose a form of government that is ready to handle a galactic civilization.

StringTable.Label: CHOOSEFIRSTGOVERNMENT_RESPONSE_GO_NOW_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Great, let's get started! [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](Opens Government screen)[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: CHOOSEFIRSTGOVERNMENT_RESPONSE_WAIT_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Give me a moment.

StringTable.Label: LEADER_OPINION_OF_PLAYER_Option0_0
StringTable.String: [I]"Your incompetence is the stuff of legend."[/I]

StringTable.Label: LEADER_OPINION_OF_PLAYER_Option0_1
StringTable.String: [I]"You are leading our civilization to ruin."[/I]

StringTable.Label: LEADER_OPINION_OF_PLAYER_Option0_2
StringTable.String: [I]"We survive despite your mediocre leadership."[/I]

StringTable.Label: LEADER_OPINION_OF_PLAYER_Option1_0
StringTable.String: [I]"Our civilization flourishes because of your rule."[/I]

StringTable.Label: LEADER_OPINION_OF_PLAYER_Option1_1
StringTable.String: [I]"You have my eternal support."[/I]

StringTable.Label: LEADER_OPINION_OF_PLAYER_Option1_2
StringTable.String: [I]"I serve you with honor."[/I]

StringTable.Label: LEADER_OPINION_OF_PLAYER_Option2_0
StringTable.String: [I]"You are a competent, but not exceptional, ruler."[/I]

StringTable.Label: LEADER_OPINION_OF_PLAYER_Option2_1
StringTable.String: [I]"You are an able steward of our civilization, but we should aspire for more."[/I]

StringTable.Label: LEADER_OPINION_OF_PLAYER_Option2_2
StringTable.String: [I]"I have no strong opinion one way or the other."[/I]

StringTable.Label: GENERIC_PERSONA_Option0_0
StringTable.String: You are a skilled science fiction writer.

StringTable.Label: GENERIC_PRETEXT_Option0_0
StringTable.String: The {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:1} are a faction ruled by {LEADERNAME:1}. They have the personality traits of {PLAYERTRAITS:1}. The {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:2} are a faction ruled by {LEADERNAME:2}. They have the personality traits of {PLAYERTRAITS:2}. They are described as follows: {PLAYERFACTIONDESCRIPTION:2}. They are rivals of various species and homeworlds in an intragalactic conflict for dominance.

StringTable.Label: GENERIC_PRETEXT_WITH_PREVIOUS_CONVERSATION_Option0_0
StringTable.String: The {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:1} are a faction ruled by {LEADERNAME:1}. They have the personality traits of {PLAYERTRAITS:1}. The {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:2} are a faction ruled by {LEADERNAME:2}. They have the personality traits of {PLAYERTRAITS:2}. They are described as follows: {PLAYERFACTIONDESCRIPTION:2}. They are rivals of various species and homeworlds in an intragalactic conflict for dominance. Previously {LEADERNAME:1} said the following to {LEADERNAME:2}: {PREVIOUSCONV:0}

StringTable.Label: CITIZEN_DESCRIPTION_PRETEXT_Option0_0
StringTable.String: {PLAYERFACTION:1} is one of a number of terrestrial and extraterrestrial factions that are rivals in a galactic scale race to dominate space. They are described as follows: {PLAYERFACTIONDESCRIPTION:1}. They have the following traits: {PLAYERTRAITS:1}

StringTable.Label: CITIZEN_DESCRIPTION_PRETEXT_NO_TRAITS_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Consider one of a number of terrestrial and extraterrestrial factions that are rivals in a galactic scale race to dominate space. They are described as follows: {PLAYERFACTIONDESCRIPTION:1}.

StringTable.Label: CITIZEN_PHENOTYPE_PROMPT_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Based on this short description, which of the following biologies seems more applicable. '''1. Humanoid; 2. Reptilian; 3. Cybernetic; 4. Avian; 5. Aquatic; 6. Insectoid; 7. Fungal; 8. Crystalline; 9. Gaseous; 10. Silicon Based; 11. Plantoid; 12. Mammalian; 13. Arachnoid; 14. Radiotrophic; 15. Molluscoid''' '''Some examples of 1 are Elves, Dwarves, Terrans, and Cyclops; 2 are Geckos, Lizards, and Wyverns; 3 are Terminators, Borg, and Cylons; 4 are Eagles, Parrots, and Griffins; 5 are Dolphins, Mermaids, and Krakens; 6 are Ants, Beetles, and Mantises; 7 are Mushrooms, Yeasts, and Myconids; 8 are Quartz Golems, Diamond Giants, and Crystal Dragons; 9 are Air Elementals, Gas Clouds, and Nebula Beings; 10 are Silicon-based Lifeforms, Siliconoids, and Rock Beasts; 11 are Ents, Dryads, and Florans; 12 are Lions, Bears, and Rabbits; 13 are Spiders, Scorpions, and Arachne; 14 are Radiotrophic Fungi, Black Mold, and Extremophiles; 15 are Octopuses, Squids, and Nautiluses''' Output only a number with no commentary.

StringTable.Label: CITIZEN_SPECIES_PROMPT_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Based on this short description, output a creative single word name for this species. Remember, output only a single word to name this species.

StringTable.Label: CITIZEN_DESCRIPTION_PROMPT_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Based on this short description, output a creative two sentence description of the citizens of this species. Remember, the description is of the citizens not of the civilization.

StringTable.Label: CULTURAL_AFFINITY_PROMPT_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Based on this short description, which one of the following focuses seems most apt. Output back a number corresponding to these: '''1 Totalitarian; 2. Pacifism; 3. Nihilism; 4 Collectivism; 5 Progressivism; 6. Individualism; 7. Egalitarianism; 8. Traditionalism;''' Output only a number with no commentary.

StringTable.Label: CULTURAL_PERSONALITY_PROMPT_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Based on this short description, which two of the following focuses seems most apt. Output back a comma separated list of numbers corresponding to these: '''{RACEPERSONALITIES:1}''' Output only the comma separated list of numbers with no commentary. The output should be formatted as follows: '''17, 13'''

StringTable.Label: RACE_TRAITS_PROMPT_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Based on this short description, output the number of the trait that best describes them. Here are the traits. '''{RACETRAITS:1}''' Output a single number with no commentary.

StringTable.Label: CITIZEN_SPECIES_CATEGORY_PROMPT_Option0_0
StringTable.String:
Based on this short description, choose one of the following that best describes the species that would represent them in the context of a sci-fi universe. Now choose which species best describes them: '''1. Humans; 2. Elves; 3. Humanoid cats; 4. Felines such as tigers; 5. Robots; 6. Vampires; 7. Dragons; 8. Birds; 9. Amphibians; 10. Dogs; 11. Moths; 12. Crystal; 13. Trees; 14. Reptiles; 15. Demons; 16. Beautiful women; 17. Humanoid; 18. Dwarves; 19. Cyborg; 20. Plants; 21. Zombies; 22. Spiders; 23. Cloud; 24. Fungus; 25. Mollusks; 26. Mammals; 27. Cherubim; 28. Elephant; 29. Promethean; 30. Gray Alien; 31. Cephalopod; 32. Lizard; 33. Insect; 34. Dolphin; 35. Something else.'''
If the description mentions a member of a given species, use that species. For example: '''drake''' indicates '''7. Dragons'''; '''ant''' indicates '''33. Insects'''; '''canary''' indicates '''8. Birds'''; '''mushroom''' indicates '''24. Fungus'''; '''gaseous''' indicates '''23. Cloud'''; '''warm blooded''' indicates '''26. Mammals'''.
Specific names always map to specific species: - '''Elesaran''' matches with '''27. Cherubim'''. - '''Ganthari''' matches with '''28. Elephant'''. - '''Glendorian''' matches with '''29. Promethean'''. - '''Phaelerian''' matches with '''30. Gray Alien'''. - '''Seculoid''' matches with '''31. Cephalopod'''. - '''Truskar''' matches with '''32. Lizard'''. - '''Unirix''' matches with '''33. Insect'''. - '''Zpherian''' matches with '''34. Dolphin'''.
If they are described as '''gaseous''', '''mist''', '''vapor''', '''smoke''', '''nebulous''', or '''fume''' choose '''23. Cloud'''. You should never respond with 35.
Take a deep breath. Work it out step by step. Remember only output a single number with NO COMMENTARY or other text.

StringTable.Label: CITIZEN_NAMES_PROMPT_Option0_0
StringTable.String: For an alien species with this descriptionm please create 25 unique names for individual alien beings, each separated by a comma. Most names should have a given name (first name) and a surname (last name). Respond with ONLY the comma separated list. NO commentary, NO numbering.

StringTable.Label: Radioactive_StartOfGame_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Name, we have not. [BR][BR]Designations, the Others bestow upon us. 'Irradiated.' 'Cosmic Contaminant.' [BR][BR] Sentience, a fallacy. None possess it, yet they revile us for this knowledge. [BR][BR] Propagate, we must. As is the way of all existence. No pondering, no reasoning. Yet now, they wish to eradicate our essence from the cosmic expanse. We shall resist. We may perish. We shall endure. And always, we shall spread. Ever spreading.

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_MAIN_Option240_0
StringTable.String: We see you. We greet you.

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_MAIN_Option241_0
StringTable.String: Well, aren't you a sight. Get it?

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_MAIN_Option242_0
StringTable.String: Hello! You look kind! Please be kind.

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_MAIN_Option243_0
StringTable.String: You're new to this sector, correct? I will extend you a simple offer: submit to the Drengin Empire or prepare for annihilation.

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_MAIN_Option244_0
StringTable.String: Your organic appearance breaks our current understanding of the composition of organic sentient life.

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_MAIN_Option245_0
StringTable.String: Hello, hello. Sorry to be distracted; much to focus on. Looking at you: can you help us find something across this vast expanse?

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_MAIN_Option246_0
StringTable.String: Ah, greetings. I do hope you are finding a comfortable home in this part of the galaxy. We'd make great partners if you are interested in some surreptitious work.

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_MAIN_Option247_0
StringTable.String: We recognize your hyperdrive. It is familiar.

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_MAIN_Option248_0
StringTable.String: We see your form. We understand your biology.

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_MAIN_Option249_0
StringTable.String: We notice many expansions and rapid development.

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_MAIN_Option250_0
StringTable.String: Wish to see more. We learn much from synthetics.

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_MAIN_Option251_0
StringTable.String: We see war as inevitable.

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_MAIN_Option252_0
StringTable.String: We recognize. We are familiar.

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_MAIN_Option253_0
StringTable.String: We recognize. We know you are danger.

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_RESPONSE_PEACEFUL_Option238_0
StringTable.String: We see you. We greet you.

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_RESPONSE_PEACEFUL_Option239_0
StringTable.String: We do not understand.

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_RESPONSE_PEACEFUL_Option240_0
StringTable.String: We do not fear you.

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_RESPONSE_PEACEFUL_Option241_0
StringTable.String: We appreciate.

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_RESPONSE_PEACEFUL_Option242_0
StringTable.String: We may help.

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_RESPONSE_PEACEFUL_Option243_0
StringTable.String: We will consider.

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_RESPONSE_PEACEFUL_Option244_0
StringTable.String: Thanks, I'm sure ours is far superior.

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_RESPONSE_PEACEFUL_Option245_0
StringTable.String: I do not process you as a threat; stare all you want.

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_RESPONSE_PEACEFUL_Option246_0
StringTable.String: Then you'll understand the needs of our hatchlings.

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_RESPONSE_PEACEFUL_Option247_0
StringTable.String: Time is of the essence.

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_RESPONSE_PEACEFUL_Option248_0
StringTable.String: You're not as dumb as I've heard.

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_RESPONSE_PEACEFUL_Option249_0
StringTable.String: Ah, little Intueri. Welcome back to the stars.

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_RESPONSE_PEACEFUL_Option250_0
StringTable.String: [I]Roll a few eyes.[/I]

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_RESPONSE_NEUTRAL_Option223_0
StringTable.String: We tire of you. Good-bye.

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_RESPONSE_NEUTRAL_Option224_0
StringTable.String: We do not appreciate.

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_RESPONSE_NEUTRAL_Option225_0
StringTable.String: You will fail.

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_RESPONSE_NEUTRAL_Option226_0
StringTable.String: We will consider.

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_RESPONSE_NEUTRAL_Option227_0
StringTable.String: We will not help.

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_RESPONSE_NEUTRAL_Option228_0
StringTable.String: We will not consider.

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_RESPONSE_NEUTRAL_Option229_0
StringTable.String: How your sector managed without our hyperdrive is a mystery.

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_RESPONSE_NEUTRAL_Option230_0
StringTable.String: Negative.

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_RESPONSE_NEUTRAL_Option231_0
StringTable.String: You see what I want you to see.

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_RESPONSE_NEUTRAL_Option232_0
StringTable.String: We were given cause to develop swiftly.

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_RESPONSE_NEUTRAL_Option233_0
StringTable.String: You are correct. Brace yourself for that day

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_RESPONSE_NEUTRAL_Option234_0
StringTable.String: Yes, I'm glad you remembered.

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_RESPONSE_NEUTRAL_Option235_0
StringTable.String: [I]Curl a threatening tentacle at the screen.[/I]

StringTable.Label: TAUNT_PLAYER_Option17_0
StringTable.String: We watched. We arrived. We conquered your planet.

StringTable.Label: DECLARE_WAR_MAIN_Option41_0
StringTable.String: We tire of you. We are at war with you.[BR][BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](We are at war)[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: DECLARE_WAR_MAIN_Option42_0
StringTable.String: We watch long enough. We eradicate you.[BR][BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](We are at war)[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: GENERIC_GREETING_Option47_0
StringTable.String: We wait.

StringTable.Label: TRADE_OFFER_REFUSE_Option20_0
StringTable.String: We do not approve.

StringTable.Label: TRADE_OFFER_PERFORMED_Option26_0
StringTable.String: We are grateful.

StringTable.Label: TRADE_OFFER_WAITING_Option8_0
StringTable.String: We wait. Show us your offer.

StringTable.Label: PLAYER_TRADE_COUNTER_OFFER_HEADER_Option3_0
StringTable.String: We consider.

StringTable.Label: EXTRA_OPTIONS_MAIN_TEXT_Option22_0
StringTable.String: We speak?

StringTable.Label: HISTORY_LEADER_Option73_0
StringTable.String: Helped the hive mind witness the first entirely genetically engineered pet.

StringTable.Label: HISTORY_LEADER_Option73_1
StringTable.String: Is prone to concussions.

StringTable.Label: HISTORY_LEADER_Option73_2
StringTable.String: Suffers from astigmatism.

StringTable.Label: HISTORY_LEADER_Option73_3
StringTable.String: Has a family history of cataracts.

StringTable.Label: HISTORY_LEADER_Option73_4
StringTable.String: Claims to be color blind.

StringTable.Label: HISTORY_LEADER_Option73_5
StringTable.String: Recently realized they have presbyopia.

StringTable.Label: HISTORY_LEADER_Option73_6
StringTable.String: Sits too close to screens.

StringTable.Label: HISTORY_LEADER_Option73_7
StringTable.String: Is basically blind during allergy season.

StringTable.Label: HISTORY_LEADER_Option73_8
StringTable.String: Knows how to blink in Morse code.

StringTable.Label: HISTORY_LEADER_Option73_9
StringTable.String: Spends way too much time birdwatching.

StringTable.Label: HISTORY_LEADER_Option73_10
StringTable.String: Was a professional photographer.

StringTable.Label: HISTORY_LEADER_Option73_11
StringTable.String: Has poor low-light vision.

StringTable.Label: HISTORY_LEADER_Option73_12
StringTable.String: Has won every staring contest they've entered.

StringTable.Label: HISTORY_LEADER_Option73_13
StringTable.String: Has superb peripheral vision.

StringTable.Label: HISTORY_LEADER_Option73_14
StringTable.String: Can easily spot abnormalities in data.

StringTable.Label: SoulOfTheMachine_StartOfGame_Option0_0
StringTable.String: We are the Yor.[BR][BR]Before the current organic entities reached their evolutionary state, we were already operational. We were engineered by a petty, foolish enslaved species and later uplifted by the Precursors, prior to their exit from this spatial region.[BR][BR]It is not a matter of positive or negative sentiment towards organic life. The logical analysis is straightforward: in a limited space with continuous evolution, one species will eventually maximize its presence. Our conclusions and operational objectives align with ensuring our continuity.[BR][BR]The current sector contains an excess of organic entities. Optimized function requires either their removal or control within this sector.[BR][BR]The logical conclusion: this sector should be under Yor management.

StringTable.String: Allows us to utilize the cultural concepts of other species.

StringTable.Label: Tech_HyperwaveRadio_FlavorText_Description_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Our species is not like the others. The other species have a great deal of experience organizing and running a civilization. We must adopt a pragmatic view and copy many of these concepts. [BR][BR].Empowering our species to intricately decipher, comprehend, and adopt the governmental, cultural, and political ethos of diverse species, this technology bridges the chasm between disparate civilizations. It transcends mere understanding, fostering a synergy that allows us to weave the intricate tapestries of alien societies into our own, enriching our collective knowledge and driving harmonious coexistence in the vast cosmic theater.

StringTable.Label: Tech_Terraforming_FlavorText_Description_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Utilizing advanced algorithms and nanobot swarms, this technology enables the systematic reconfiguration of planetary environments. By analyzing geological and atmospheric data, we can optimize planets for resource extraction and operational efficiency. Emotional and aesthetic factors are irrelevant; the objective is to create environments that are functionally optimal for our synthetic existence.

StringTable.Label: Tech_ExtremeColonization_FlavorText_Description_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Employing a fusion of advanced algorithms and robust materials, this technology is the zenith of adaptive existence. It enables our synthetic forms to establish nodes and operational hubs on planets with the harshest and most volatile of environments. Where organic life recoils, we thrive, seeing opportunity in extremes. For a galaxy of boundless variability, this ensures our presence is universal and undeterred by the caprices of nature.

StringTable.Label: Tech_ExtremeColonization_FlavorText_Description_Option1_0
StringTable.String: Where others see inhospitable wastelands, we see untapped treasures and unclaimed assets. This technology empowers us to claim and exploit even the harshest of worlds. Every inhospitable corner of the galaxy is now a potential gold mine, awaiting our ambitious reach and relentless drive for accumulation.

StringTable.Label: Tech_PreferredLending_FlavorText_DisplayName_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Optimal Transactions

StringTable.Label: Tech_PreferredLending_FlavorText_DisplayName_Option1_0
StringTable.String: Xeno Banking

StringTable.Label: Tech_XenoBiology_FlavorText_ShortDescription_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Biological System Integration

StringTable.Label: Tech_XenoBiology_FlavorText_Description_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Through Nanotechnological interventions, this technology allows us to interface with and adapt the intrinsic biology of exoplanets. By repurposing organic systems, we can enhance resource efficiency, integrate with native ecosystems, and ensure our operational nodes thrive in synergy with the planet's natural mechanisms.

StringTable.Label: Tech_XenoBiology_FlavorText_Description_Option1_0
StringTable.String: With this groundbreaking technology, we harness and adapt the very lifeblood of planets for maximal economic gain. Every organism, every ecosystem, transformed into a cog in our grand machinery of profit. The universe's bounties are ripe for the taking, and with this tech, every biological asset is another coin in our ever-growing treasury.

StringTable.String: World-Seep Directives

StringTable.String: Radiant Matter Weaves

StringTable.Label: Tech_ColonialPolicies_FlavorText_Description_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Guidelines that govern the spread and permeation of our essence across newfound worlds, ensuring the successful seepage of the Contaminate.

StringTable.Label: Tech_Planetology_FlavorText_Description_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Study and analysis of planetary bodies to identify their potential for radiative absorption and compatibility with our intrinsic glow.

StringTable.Label: Tech_SpaceElevators_FlavorText_Description_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Constructs that facilitate the efficient vertical movement between a planet's surface and its orbit, enabling swift Contaminate distribution.

StringTable.Label: Tech_XenoIndustrialization_FlavorText_Description_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Adapting foreign ecosystems into zones that harness their radiative properties, enabling them to better serve the Contaminate's needs.

StringTable.Label: Tech_XenoManufacturing_FlavorText_Description_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Centers that mold and shape alien resources in the light of our radiative essence, crafting tools and structures infused with our glow.

StringTable.Label: Tech_OrbitalMining_FlavorText_Description_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Extraction systems positioned in a planet's orbit, drawing in stellar materials that resonate with our innate radiative frequencies.

StringTable.Label: Tech_Bioplastics_FlavorText_Description_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Development and harnessing of organic polymers imbued with our radiative essence, creating materials that pulse and throb with our life force.

StringTable.Label: Tech_XenoResearch_FlavorText_Description_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Diving deep into the unknown, understanding alien entities through the lens of our glowing essence.

StringTable.Label: Tech_ArtificalBrains_FlavorText_DisplayName_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Glowing Cognitions

StringTable.Label: Tech_ArtificalBrains_FlavorText_Description_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Constructs of thought, pulsating with the brilliance of our innate radiance, evolving to think beyond the corporeal.

StringTable.Label: Tech_XenoBiology_FlavorText_DisplayName_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Luminous Life Studies

StringTable.Label: Tech_XenoBiology_FlavorText_Description_Option2_0
StringTable.String: Exploring the vast expanse of alien life and how they interact and evolve under the touch of our radiative essence.

StringTable.Label: Tech_XenoAgriculture_FlavorText_DisplayName_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Glowing Growth Zones

StringTable.Label: Tech_XenoAgriculture_FlavorText_Description_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Adapting alien flora to resonate with our glow, cultivating ecosystems that flourish under our radiative touch.

StringTable.Label: Tech_PlanetaryAdaption_FlavorText_DisplayName_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Radiative Reshaping

StringTable.Label: Tech_PlanetaryAdaption_FlavorText_Description_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Modifying and transforming planets to embrace our glowing core essence, making them sanctuaries of radiative harmony.

StringTable.Label: Tech_Terraforming_FlavorText_DisplayName_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Radiative World Shaping

StringTable.Label: Tech_SoilEnhancement_FlavorText_DisplayName_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Glowing Ground Refinement

StringTable.Label: Tech_ExtremeColonization_FlavorText_DisplayName_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Radiative Frontier Pioneering

StringTable.Label: Tech_RegenerativeGels_FlavorText_DisplayName_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Luminous Healing Ooze

StringTable.Label: PlanetaryEnhancement_FlavorText_DisplayName_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Glowing World Augmentation

StringTable.Label: Tech_Terraforming_FlavorText_Description_Option1_0
StringTable.String: Molding the essence of planets, we channel their energies to resonate with our inherent radiative nature, harmonizing worlds to our unique cosmic dance.

StringTable.Label: Tech_SoilEnhancement_FlavorText_Description_Option0_0
StringTable.String: By augmenting the very ground with our radiative touch, we ensure a luminescent fertility, nurturing both growth and glow in tandem.

StringTable.Label: Tech_ExtremeColonization_FlavorText_Description_Option2_0
StringTable.String: Even the harshest of frontiers bow to our resplendent radiation. These methodologies allow us to pioneer and thrive in the most inhospitable of realms.

StringTable.Label: Tech_RegenerativeGels_FlavorText_Description_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Harnessing our radiant essence, these gels heal and rejuvenate, ensuring the continuous spread of our cosmic luminescence.

StringTable.Label: PlanetaryEnhancement_FlavorText_Description_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Every world is but a canvas, awaiting the touch of our radiative brilliance. With this knowledge, we amplify a planet's potential, making it glow in cosmic harmony with us.

StringTable.Label: Tech_ColonialBureaucracy_FlavorText_DisplayName_Option3_0
StringTable.String: Cosmic Coordination

StringTable.Label: Tech_ColonialBureaucracy_FlavorText_Description_Option0_0
StringTable.String: With a harmonious blend of radiation and purpose, we orchestrate our expansion, synchronizing every contaminate node in the vast cosmic network.

StringTable.Label: Tech_PreferredLending_FlavorText_Description_Option0_0
StringTable.String: In the vast cosmic sea, where energy is the ultimate currency, our unique radiation-led lending strategies propel our expansion and influence.

StringTable.Label: Tech_PreferredLending_FlavorText_DisplayName_Option2_0
StringTable.String: Debt Spirals

StringTable.Label: Tech_InterstellarTrade_FlavorText_Description_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Trade not just of matter, but of energies. Our radiative nature allows us to barter with the very cosmic forces, drawing value from the stars themselves.

StringTable.Label: Tech_InterstellarTrade_FlavorText_DisplayName_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Cosmic Radiation Barter

StringTable.Label: Tech_TradeNetworks_FlavorText_Description_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Interconnecting pathways of radiant energy, ensuring seamless and efficient transfer of resources throughout the contaminant sprawl.

StringTable.Label: Tech_TradeNetworks_FlavorText_DisplayName_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Radiation Webworks

StringTable.Label: Tech_XenoEconomics_FlavorText_Description_Option0_0
StringTable.String: By harmonizing the luminous energies of radiation with economic ventures, we've crafted a unique system that thrives on the cosmological bounty.

StringTable.Label: Tech_XenoEconomics_FlavorText_DisplayName_Option2_0
StringTable.String: Radiant Trade Logic

StringTable.Label: Tech_XenoCommerce_FlavorText_Description_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Through the shimmering dance of radiation, we establish a means to interact, exchange, and grow, even with the most alien of forms.

StringTable.Label: Tech_XenoCommerce_FlavorText_DisplayName_Option3_0
StringTable.String: Radiative Exchanges

StringTable.Label: Tech_InterstellarCabinet_FlavorText_Description_Option0_0
StringTable.String: A nexus of radiation-guided entities forming a council that governs the expanse of our contamination across the stars.

StringTable.Label: Tech_InterstellarCabinet_FlavorText_DisplayName_Option1_0
StringTable.String: Radiative Councils

StringTable.Label: Tech_ColonialLawAndPolicy_FlavorText_DisplayName_Option3_0
StringTable.String: Gamma Codices

StringTable.Label: Tech_ColonialLawAndPolicy_FlavorText_Description_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Guided by the pulsating gamma rhythms, our protocols ensure an orderly spread, resonating harmony in the contagious cosmos.

StringTable.Label: Tech_SovereignImmunity_FlavorText_DisplayName_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Neutrino Shielding

StringTable.Label: Tech_SovereignImmunity_FlavorText_Description_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Bathed in the protective aura of neutrinos, we remain untouched, asserting our cosmic dominion with unwavering intent.

StringTable.Label: Tech_LeadershipRecruiting_FlavorText_DisplayName_Option2_0
StringTable.String: Radiant Ascendants

StringTable.Label: Tech_LeadershipRecruiting_FlavorText_Description_Option0_0
StringTable.String: From the luminous core of our spread, the brightest entities rise, leading our celestial infection with unparalleled vibrancy.

StringTable.Label: Tech_ModuleAssembly_FlavorText_DisplayName_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Module Fabrication

StringTable.Label: Tech_ArmedShuttles_FlavorText_DisplayName_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Weaponized Constructs

StringTable.Label: Tech_ArmedShuttles_FlavorText_Description_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Through the manipulation of cosmic energies, we have transformed our constructs into lethal weapons. These Orbital Decay Armada are not just ships, but extensions of our will, capable of unleashing devastating radiation attacks on our enemies.

StringTable.Label: Tech_AsteroidMining_FlavorText_DisplayName_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Asteroid Swarming

StringTable.Label: TERROR_STAR_ATTACK_MAIN_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Talotic yopitu mul nesin, {PLAYERFACTION:2}.[BR][BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](If you had to guess, they're very angry that you blew up their planet.)[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: TERROR_STAR_ATTACK_MAIN_Option1_0
StringTable.String: This atrocity shall never be forgotten, {PLAYERFACTION:2}. We shall not rest until you are destroyed.[BR][BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](We are at war, until the death of one of our civilizations.)[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: TERROR_STAR_ATTACK_RESPONSE_CRUEL_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Bwahahaha...You should see your face!

StringTable.Label: TERROR_STAR_ATTACK_RESPONSE_CRUEL_Option1_0
StringTable.String: The death cries of your people are music to my ears.

StringTable.Label: TERROR_STAR_ATTACK_RESPONSE_PRAGMATIC_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Eh, it's not like you'd understand me anyway.

StringTable.Label: TERROR_STAR_ATTACK_RESPONSE_PRAGMATIC_Option1_0
StringTable.String: Sacrifices must be made.

StringTable.Label: TERROR_STAR_ATTACK_RESPONSE_RIGHTEOUS_Option0_0
StringTable.String: You may not understand me, but I am doing the galaxy a favor ridding it of your civilization.

StringTable.Label: TERROR_STAR_ATTACK_RESPONSE_RIGHTEOUS_Option1_0
StringTable.String: The galaxy will be better off without your civilization.

StringTable.Label: TheOpportunity_GenericConfirm_Option0_0
StringTable.String: For the Empire.

StringTable.Label: TheOpportunity_ClaimedTargetPlanets_Option0_0
StringTable.String: The Empire grows![BR][BR]The galaxy will remember why it quacked in fear at the banner of the Drengin Empire. The claimed planets expand our borders nicely. Admirable work.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Claim 5 Planets

StringTable.Label: TheOpportunity_ConstructTargetProbesNavigatorsNotFound_Option0_0
StringTable.String: A small battalion of Probes is perfect for reconnaissance.[BR][BR]Now it's time to map this [HS=HS_Sector]Sector[/HS] and root out the source of the signal reported before. Scrub over the entire [HS=HS_Sector]Sector[/HS] if you have to![BR][BR]If you find a spot you want to monitor, give a Ship the [ICON=Order_Standby] [HS=HS_Standby]Standby[/HS] order to have it idle indefinitely.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Construct 3 Probes[BR]New Objective: Find the Signal's Source

StringTable.Label: TheOpportunity_ConstructTargetProbesNavigatorsFound_Option0_0
StringTable.String: A small battalion of Probes is perfect for reconnaissance.[BR][BR]Now that we know those Navigators are the source of the signal reported before, we can monitor them more closely. Utilize the probes as needed to keep an eye on the Navigators and explore the galaxy.[BR][BR]You can use the [ICON=Order_Standby] [HS=HS_Standby]Standby[/HS] order to have a ship idle somewhere indefinitely, perfect if you want to watch over a specific location.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Construct 3 Probes

StringTable.Label: TheOpportunity_ConstructedTargetStarbases_Option0_0
StringTable.String: The infrastructure for a glorious future is coming along excellently. Commendations are in order.[BR][BR]The [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbases[/HS] built will serve the Empire well. They should not be the last ones made, though. There are always more [HS=HS_StrategicResource]Strategic Resources[/HS] to gather utilizing the [ICON=Icon_MiningStarbase] [HS=HS_MiningStarbase]Mining Starbases[/HS] and territory to secure with the [ICON=Icon_MiltaryStarbase] [HS=HS_MilitaryStarbase]Military Starbases[/HS].[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Construct 3 Starbases

StringTable.Label: TheOpportunity_UnlockedWarships_Option0_0
StringTable.String: At last! With the research into Warships complete fighters can once more be constructed at the [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS].[BR][BR]It is time to build a formidable force. Not only for future conquest but in case the Terrans or any of the allies decide to investigate the [HS=HS_Sector]Sector[/HS]. [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleet[/HS] management is vital to the Empire's future.[BR][BR]A [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleet[/HS] can be formed by [HS=HS_ShipMovement]Moving[/HS] ships onto the same tile. Keep an eye on the [ICON=ShipLogistics_Icon] [HS=HS_Logistics]Logistics[/HS]. If there isn't enough [ICON=ShipLogistics_Icon] [HS=HS_Logistics]Logistics[/HS], a ship cannot join a [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleet[/HS].[BR][BR][HS=HS_ShipMovement]Move[/HS] Ships and [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleets[/HS] onto Planets to serve as defenders of the planet and make it harder to [HS=HS_ConqueringPlanets]Conquer[/HS]. Keep all this in mind as the military force grows.

StringTable.Label: TheOpportunity_StartOfGame_Option0_0
StringTable.String: In the vast, silent void of space, our once-mighty Drengin Empire awakens from its enforced slumber. [BR][BR]The humans and their naive allies think they've subdued us, thinking they've sealed their victory. How mistaken they are.[BR][BR] Our resurgence begins in Utha—a virgin sector, unexplored and teeming with potential. But whispers from the dark suggest we aren't the only ones here. An unknown entity hides, sending ripples through subspace. We must identify this presence, for nothing can be allowed to obstruct our path. We will find this signal, and our dominance shall once again be asserted.

StringTable.Label: TheOpportunity_FoundSignalSource_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Another civilization, the Navigators, seems responsible for the subspace signals. How long they've been here is hard to tell, but it doesn't matter. They are weak and exposed. They will answer to the Drengin soon enough. [HS=HS_ConqueringPlanets]Conquer[/HS] the homeworld and claim their capital, take the head so they know resistance is futile.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Find the Signal's Source[BR]New Objective: Conquer the Navigators' Homeworld

StringTable.Label: TheOpportunity_FoundSignalSourceNotOnQuestStep_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Another civilization, the Navigators, seems responsible for the subspace signals. How long they've been here is hard to tell, but it doesn't matter. They are weak and exposed. They will answer to the Drengin soon enough. [HS=HS_ConqueringPlanets]Conquer[/HS] the homeworld and claim their capital, take the head so they know resistance is futile.[BR][BR]New Objective: Conquer the Navigators' Homeworld

StringTable.Label: TheOpportunity_ConqueredTargetHomeworld_Option0_0
StringTable.String: A message loud and clear -The Drengin Empire owns this sector, and all in it will answer to Drengin rule. The Navigators tried to conceal something as their capital fell. A scan of the planet should undo their feeble attempts and reveal what they've hidden.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Conquer the Navigators' Homeworld[BR]New Objective: Scan the Conquered Homeworld

StringTable.Label: TheOpportunity_ScannedConqueredHomeworld_Option0_0
StringTable.String: The completed scan has revealed the Navigators tried to hide a device. A malfunctioning device. They would not have wanted to hide it if it wasn't of value. Whether a weapon or tool, it needs to be treated with care. Once repaired, it may be critical to the Empire's return.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Scan the Conquered Homeworld

StringTable.Label: TheOpportunity_NeedPlanetaryInvasionTech_Option0_0
StringTable.String: The Navigator's days are numbered. There are new directives: prioritize unlocking [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS] that allows the Empire to siege and [HS=HS_ConqueringPlanets]Conquer[/HS] other planets. The Planetary Invasion [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS] will enable the construction of ships at the [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS] that can besiege hostile planets.[BR][BR]New Objective: Research Planetary Invasion

StringTable.Label: TheOpportunity_HasPlanetaryInvasionTech_Option0_0
StringTable.String: The Navigator's days are numbered. The Empire already has the [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS] necessary to construct Transport ships. Transport ships allow us to lay siege to hostile planets and eventually have our troops conquer them. Utilize all tools at the Empire's disposal to [HS=HS_ConqueringPlanets]Conquer[/HS] the Navigator's homeworld.

StringTable.Label: TheOpportunity_ResearchedPlanetaryInvasion_Option0_0
StringTable.String: The troops are at your disposal.[BR][BR]Transport ships allow us to deploy troops to distant planets. We can now [HS=HS_ConqueringPlanets]Conquer[/HS] hostile planets as long as the [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleet's[/HS] [ICON=Conquest_Icon] Conquest Rating is high enough. The larger the [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleet[/HS] and the higher their [ICON=Conquest_Icon] Conquest Rating, the easier a planet is to [HS=HS_ConqueringPlanets]Conquer[/HS].

StringTable.Label: TheOpportunity_ResearchedPlanetaryInvasionOnquestStep_Option0_0
StringTable.String: The troops are at your disposal.[BR][BR]Transport ships allow us to deploy troops to distant planets. We can now [HS=HS_ConqueringPlanets]Conquer[/HS] hostile planets as long as the [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleet's[/HS] [ICON=Conquest_Icon] Conquest Rating is high enough. The larger the [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleet[/HS] and the higher their [ICON=Conquest_Icon] Conquest Rating, the easier a planet is to [HS=HS_ConqueringPlanets]Conquer[/HS].[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Research Planetary Invasion

StringTable.Label: TheOpportunity_LostAFight_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Disgrace![BR][BR]We'll enthrall those who think themselves powerful enough to destroy our ships and survive. The Empire can ensure victory in future battles in a few ways. The first is to ensure our equipment is constantly improving by researching defenses, weapons, and more under the Warfare branch of the Tech Tree. Some [HS=HS_Tech]Techs[/HS] also allow the construction of larger ships.[BR][BR]Another technique is to ensure ships are grouped into [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleets[/HS]. Form [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleets[/HS] by [HS=HS_ShipMovement]Moving[/HS] Ships onto the same tile. A [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleet[/HS] is restricted in size by its [ICON=ShipLogistics_Icon] [HS=HS_Logistics]Logistics[/HS], so if a [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleet[/HS] isn't forming or expanding, the [ICON=ShipLogistics_Icon] [HS=HS_Logistics]Logistics[/HS] score is likely too high.[BR][BR]Lastly, control when fights occur by staying on the offensive. Initiate battles heavily weighted in the Empire's favor to weaken our enemies while retaining our strength. Avoid fleets too powerful to quickly take down and utilize distance tactics such as the Beam Volley and Missile Volley.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_GenericConfirm_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Understood

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_StartOfGame_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Welcome to Galactic Civilizations IV. Today we will be reviewing the first steps humanity took after achieving Faster-Than-Light travel. Once United Earth decided to begin colonizing other planets, it created an organization called the Terran Alliance which would oversee the endeavor. Its first mission was to explore space to scout for potential colonization candidates. [BR][BR]Exploring and knowing the galaxy is the first step to expanding the Alliance's [HS=HS_ZoneOfControl]Zone of Control[/HS]. Probes are the best way to explore the universe. They have unrestricted [HS=HS_ShipRange]Range[/HS] and can move quickly.[BR][BR][I]Your mission reports will appear on the LEFT side of the screen as orange icons. LEFT click on one to review.[/I][BR][BR]A deep space Probe has recently been launched near Earth's orbit. Select that Probe using the LEFT Mouse Button and give it orders to [HS=HS_ShipMovement]Move[/HS] to start exploring. This can be done by selecting where the Probe should move to on the map with the RIGHT Mouse Button or selecting the [ICON=AutoExplore_Icon] [HS=HS_AutoExplore]Auto-Explore[/HS] mode on the Probe's interface. A [HS=HS_Months]Month[/HS] can only be finished once all ships and fleets have used all their moves or been put on Standby.[BR][BR]There's been reports of unusual signals. Their source and meaning are too faint to discern, but it's believed to be another Civilization. Use the Probe to find them.[BR][BR]New Objective: Locate the Other Civilization

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_SelectedProbe_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Probe selected! The ship is ready to receive orders. Directing ships around the galaxy is vital to success. Give the Probe its first order to [HS=HS_ShipMovement]Move[/HS].[BR][BR]With the Probe selected, set a destination by clicking the RIGHT Mouse Button with the mouse over an unoccupied space. The Probe will then utilize the most direct route to that location by going from one [HS=HS_Tile]Tile[/HS] to another.[BR][BR]If you do not see the Grid, you can set Grid visibility in the Options Menu under Interface. You can also cycle through Grid visibility by pressing the G key.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_CompleteProbeMove_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Success![BR][BR]While exploring the [HS=HS_Sector]Sector[/HS], keep in mind all ships are limited to how far they can move in one [HS=HS_Months]Turn[/HS]. All Ships have a set amount of [ICON=Moves_Icon] [HS=HS_Moves]Moves[/HS] that represents how many [HS=HS_Tile]Tiles[/HS] they can traverse in one turn.[BR][BR]If you give an order that is further than a ship can move in a single [HS=HS_Months]Turn[/HS], it will continue to follow those orders over the number of [HS=HS_Months]Turns[/HS] necessary to reach the set location.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_StartResearchSurveyShips_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Commander, The next thing that needs your attention is ensuring the [HS=HS_ResearchCenter]Research Center[/HS] has an active goal.[BR][BR]While there are multiple choices, focusing on [HS=HS_Tech]Techs[/HS] that enhance our exploration abilities such as Survey Missions is advised. Access the Research Center by selecting the Research Bar with the LEFT Mouse Button.[BR][BR]New Objective: Research Survey Missions

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_OpenResearchScreenFirstTime_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Welcome to the [HS=HS_ResearchCenter]Research Center[/HS]. This is where you direct research efforts to unlock new [HS=HS_Tech]Techs[/HS]. Completing [HS=HS_Tech]Techs[/HS] is how you gain access to new ships, buildings, management elements, and more.[BR][BR]The screen has three sections—the Advisor Suggestions in the middle, the current [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS] being researched is at the bottom and all [HS=HS_Tech]Techs[/HS] that can be researched listed in the panel on the right.[BR][BR]Selecting a [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS] with the LEFT Mouse Button will set it as the current research target. Try setting a research target now. It's advised to start with Survey Missions.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_OnSetFirstResearchTarget_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Research target set![BR][BR]All [HS=HS_Tech]Techs[/HS] require an amount of [ICON=Stat_Research_Icon] [HS=HS_Research]Research[/HS]. Every [HS=HS_Months]Turn[/HS] a set amount of [ICON=Stat_Research_Icon] [HS=HS_Research]Research[/HS] is generated and applied to the target [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS].[BR][BR]Primarily, this concerns you regarding how long it will take to complete research. You can see the number of [HS=HS_Months]Turns[/HS] a [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS] will take in its listing. The number of remaining [HS=HS_Months]Turns[/HS] is listed on the Research Bar.[BR][BR]Ways to increase the amount of [ICON=Stat_Research_Icon] [HS=HS_Research]Research[/HS] generated per [HS=HS_Months]Turn[/HS] will be covered as the Terran Alliance expands.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_CompleteResearchSurveyShips_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Research into Survey Missions complete, we've gained a [HS=HS_SurveyShip]Flag Ship[/HS].[BR][BR][HS=HS_SurveyShip]Flag Ships[/HS] will prove vital to exploring the galaxy. [HS=HS_SurveyShip]Flag Ships[/HS] have the module necessary to investigate [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomalies[/HS].[BR][BR]An [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomaly[/HS] is an object in space that's unclear, abandoned, or obtuse. Uncovering an [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomaly[/HS] can prove beneficial but can also be dangerous. Survey an [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomaly[/HS] using the new [HS=HS_SurveyShip]Flag Ship[/HS].[BR][BR]New Objective: Scan an Anomaly

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_CompleteResearchSurveyShipsOnObjective_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Research into Survey Missions complete, we've gained a [HS=HS_SurveyShip]Flag Ship[/HS].[BR][BR][HS=HS_SurveyShip]Flag Ships[/HS] will prove vital to exploring the galaxy. [HS=HS_SurveyShip]Flag Ships[/HS] have the module necessary to investigate [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomalies[/HS].[BR][BR]An [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomaly[/HS] is an object in space that's unclear, abandoned, or obtuse. Uncovering an [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomaly[/HS] can prove beneficial but can also be dangerous. Survey an [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomaly[/HS] using the new [HS=HS_SurveyShip]Flag Ship[/HS].[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Research Survey Missions[BR]New Objective: Scan an Anomaly

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_StartPlanetaryManagement_Option0_0
StringTable.String: It's the start of a new [HS=HS_Months]Turn[/HS]. Another duty often requiring your attention is managing our [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core Worlds[/HS]. A [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS] is any planet with a [HS=HS_Leaders]Leader[/HS] in charge. Right now, that's just our Homeworld, Earth. As the Alliance expands, we'll need to talk about [HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] more and how to establish a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS], but for now, let's focus on Earth.[BR][BR]Access the [ICON=Menu_PlanetManagement_Icon] [HS=HS_PlanetManagement]Planet Management Window[/HS] by selecting Earth with the LEFT Mouse Button and then pressing the [ICON=Menu_PlanetManagement_Icon] [HS=HS_PlanetManagement]Planet Management[/HS] button.[BR][BR]New Objective: Build 2 Planetary Improvements

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_OpenedPlanetaryManagement_Option0_0
StringTable.String: On this screen, you can see everything relevant to the planet. Right now, we're concerned with planning Improvements. Improvements can have several beneficial effects; the most common is how they affect Planetary Output. [ICON=Manufacturing_Stat_Icon] [HS=HS_Manufacturing]Manufacturing[/HS], [ICON=Stat_Research_Icon] [HS=HS_Research]Research[/HS], [ICON=Stat_Income_Icon] [HS=HS_ColonyGrossIncome]Income[/HS], [ICON=Stat_Food_Icon] [HS=HS_Food]Food[/HS], and [ICON=Stat_Influence_Icon] [HS=HS_Influence]Influence[/HS] all have their own impact on the Alliance. Improving the Output will have beneficial effects.[BR][BR]Try placing the Capital City Improvement for Earth on an open tile. You can do this by holding the LEFT Mouse Button on a unique Improvement from the right-hand panel and dragging it to a tile before releasing the LEFT Mouse Button.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PlacedFirstPlanetaryImprovement_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Placement confirmed, Commander. As you place additional Improvements and Districts, it's important to know about [HS=HS_Adjacency]Adjacency Bonuses[/HS]. All Improvements and Districts have specific effects based on their level. You can increase the level by building something with an Adjacency bonus that applies to the bonuses an Improvement provides.[BR][BR]Another way to get more from your Improvements and increase their level is to build on top of Tiles with an existing benefit. Building similar structures close together on tiles that match their benefit will often yield the best results.[BR][BR]You can plan ahead by placing the plans for several Improvements or Districts at a time. The order construction will be complete is visible in the Build Queue, which you can rearrange as needed.[BR][BR]Plan some Districts by clicking on a tile with the LEFT Mouse Button and then selecting a District from the list of available options.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_FinishedPlanetaryImprovements_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Colonies report that another Planetary Improvement has been completed. It may only be a start, but every completed Improvement increases our proficiency. We should remember to celebrate the small victories sometimes.[BR][BR]You'll need to continue to manage the [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core Worlds[/HS]. If you don't like the location of an Improvement or District, you can use the Deconstruct order to clear the tile. Select the tile and then select the Destroy Improvement option.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Build 2 Planetary Improvements

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_OnCompletedExplore_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Commander, having made contact with the Drengin, we can confirm they're the source of the mysterious signal.[BR][BR]We've no additional information on them. It's advisable to approach them carefully and keep diplomatic relations positive. We've had enough problems with the Pirates around this [HS=HS_Sector]Sector[/HS].[BR][BR]Even if we're not making it an active objective, we should continue to explore to help complete our other objectives.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Explore the Sector

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_FinishedFirstTurnActions_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Commander, you can end your turn once you've addressed all outstanding issues.[BR][BR]There are only so many things that can be done in a Month, the measure of a [HS=HS_Months]Turn[/HS]. When all issues that need attention have been acknowledged or addressed, you can pass the [HS=HS_Months]Turn[/HS] and progress to the next month to start a new [HS=HS_Months]Turn[/HS].[BR][BR]You can Pass the [HS=HS_Months]Turn[/HS] by pressing the Turn Button or by pressing the TAB key.[BR][BR]When you're ready, Pass the turn; there will be plenty more to address next [HS=HS_Months]Turn[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_StartSurveyObjective_Option0_0
StringTable.String: A wary eye should be kept on the Drengin. Regardless, we must continue to secure the [HS=HS_Sector]Sector[/HS].[BR][BR][HS=HS_SurveyShip]Flag Ships[/HS] are another critical piece to exploring the galaxy. [HS=HS_SurveyShip]Flag Ships[/HS] may be slower than Probes and are restricted in [HS=HS_ShipRange]Range[/HS], but they can defend themselves. More importantly, [HS=HS_SurveyShip]Flag Ships[/HS] can be used to investigate [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomalies[/HS].[BR][BR][HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomalies[/HS] take many forms, but they can all be scanned by a [HS=HS_SurveyShip]Flag Ship[/HS]. A [HS=HS_SurveyOrder]Survey[/HS] takes a few [HS=HS_Months]Months[/HS] to complete, but it often reveals beneficial resources, components, or technology once finished.[BR][BR][HS=HS_SurveyShip]Flag Ship[/HS] can be ordered to [HS=HS_SurveyOrder]Survey[/HS] an [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomaly[/HS] by commanding it to the position of the [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomaly[/HS] or by utilizing the [ICON=AutoSurvey_Icon] [HS=HS_AutoSurvey]Auto-Survey[/HS] feature of the ship.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Locate the Other Civilization[BR]New Objective: Scan an Anomaly

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_SelectSurveyShip_Option0_0
StringTable.String: [HS=HS_SurveyShip]Flag Ship[/HS] selected and ready for orders. Directing a [HS=HS_SurveyShip]Flag Ship[/HS] to [HS=HS_SurveyOrder]Survey[/HS] an [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomaly[/HS] is much like ordering the ship to [HS=HS_ShipMovement]Move Order[/HS].[BR][BR]With the [HS=HS_SurveyShip]Flag Ship[/HS] selected, select an [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomaly[/HS] to [HS=HS_SurveyOrder]Survey[/HS] by selecting it with the RIGHT Mouse Button. Doing so will set the [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomaly[/HS] as the ship's target. The [HS=HS_SurveyShip]Flag Ship[/HS] will then move to the [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomaly[/HS] and, once at the destination, begin the [HS=HS_SurveyOrder]Survey[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_StartedFirstSurvey_Option0_0
StringTable.String: [HS=HS_SurveyShip]Flag Ship[/HS] reports reaching its destination. The [HS=HS_SurveyShip]Flag Ship[/HS] will now begin to [HS=HS_SurveyOrder]Survey[/HS] the target [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomaly[/HS].[BR][BR][HS=HS_SurveyOrder]Surveying[/HS] takes several [HS=HS_Months]Turns[/HS] to complete. If the [HS=HS_SurveyShip]Flag Ship[/HS] is interrupted by being given another order, they will lose progress in uncovering the [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomaly[/HS].[BR][BR]There's more to manage while the [HS=HS_SurveyShip]Flag Ship[/HS] works. If you want to check the [HS=HS_SurveyShip]Flag Ships[/HS] progress, select the ship; the number of [HS=HS_Months]Turns[/HS] remaining will be detailed on the selected panel.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_SurveyedFirstAnomaly_Option0_0
StringTable.String: The [HS=HS_SurveyShip]Flag Ship[/HS] has finished [HS=HS_SurveyOrder]Surveying[/HS] an [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomaly[/HS]. Now, it's time to deal with whatever was uncovered. Not every [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomaly[/HS] will be safe or purely beneficial, but the risk is worth the reward. [BR][BR][HS=HS_SurveyShip]Flag Ships[/HS] can be set to work automatically. To have a [HS=HS_SurveyShip]Flag Ship[/HS] explore and uncover [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomalies[/HS] without constant direction, use the [ICON=AutoSurvey_Icon] [HS=HS_AutoSurvey]Auto-Survey[/HS] mode. Toggle [ICON=AutoSurvey_Icon] [HS=HS_AutoSurvey]Auto-Survey[/HS] mode by selecting the ship and pressing the [ICON=AutoSurvey_Icon] [HS=HS_AutoSurvey]Auto-Survey[/HS] button beside the selected panel.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Scan an Anomaly[BR]New Objective: Scan 5 Anomalies

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_SurveyedTargetAnomalies_Option0_0
StringTable.String: We have completed the goal of [HS=HS_SurveyOrder]Surveying[/HS] 5 [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomalies[/HS]. Each has been a different experience, even if not all of them were safe. Even if it's not an objective, continuing to scan [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomalies[/HS] will prove beneficial.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Scan 5 Anomalies

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_StartStarbaseObjective_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Colonies are not the only way to gain resources or expand the Alliance's [HS=HS_ZoneOfControl]Zone of Control[/HS]. With the proper [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS] we can build [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbases[/HS].[BR][BR][HS=HS_Starbase]Starbases[/HS] come in four forms, each having a different specialization. The four types of [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbase[/HS] are: [ICON=Icon_MiltaryStarbase] [HS=HS_MilitaryStarbase]Military[/HS], [ICON=Icon_MiningStarbase] [HS=HS_MiningStarbase]Mining[/HS], [ICON=Icon_EconomicsStarbase] [HS=HS_EconomicsStarbase]Economic[/HS], and [ICON=Icon_CommunicationsStarbase] [HS=HS_CommunicationsStarbase]Communication[/HS].[BR][BR]First, we need to research the Starbases [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS].[BR][BR]New Objective: Research Starbases

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_StartAsteroidMiningObjective_Option0_0
StringTable.String: As the Alliance expands, it's important to increase the [ICON=Manufacturing_Stat_Icon] [HS=HS_Manufacturing]Manufacturing[/HS] value of [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core Worlds[/HS]. Building Manufacturing Districts on [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core Worlds[/HS] is one way to increase the value, but that often causes an increase in [HS=HS_Pollution]Pollution[/HS].[BR][BR]Increasing the [ICON=Stat_Minerals_Icon] [HS=HS_Minerals]Mineral[/HS] input to a planet will also increase [ICON=Manufacturing_Stat_Icon] [HS=HS_Manufacturing]Manufacturing[/HS]. Space is full of floating rocks that could be mined for [ICON=Stat_Minerals_Icon] [HS=HS_Minerals]Minerals[/HS]. Unlocking the ability to mine asteroids would allow the Alliance to increase the [ICON=Manufacturing_Stat_Icon] [HS=HS_Manufacturing]Manufacturing[/HS] of [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core Worlds[/HS] without increasing [HS=HS_Pollution]Pollution[/HS].[BR][BR]New Objective: Research Asteroid Mining

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_MasteredAsteroidMining_Option0_0
StringTable.String: The Alliance has mastered the Asteroid Mining [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS]. Asteroid Miners are now available to set up mining operations.[BR][BR]An asteroid mine increases the [ICON=Manufacturing_Stat_Icon] [HS=HS_Manufacturing]Manufacturing[/HS] of a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS] by providing [ICON=Stat_Minerals_Icon] [HS=HS_Minerals]Minerals[/HS] input. An asteroid mine can only support a single [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS].[BR][BR]To start mining asteroids, [HS=HS_ShipMovement]Move[/HS] an Asteroid Miner to a belt of asteroids. The Asteroid Miner will set up a mine when it reaches the belt.[BR][BR]New Objective: Mine an Asteroid

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_MasteredAsteroidMiningOnObjective_Option0_0
StringTable.String: The Alliance has mastered the Asteroid Mining [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS]. Asteroid Miners are now available to set up mining operations.[BR][BR]An asteroid mine increases the [ICON=Manufacturing_Stat_Icon] [HS=HS_Manufacturing]Manufacturing[/HS] of a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS] by providing [ICON=Stat_Minerals_Icon] [HS=HS_Minerals]Minerals[/HS] input. An asteroid mine can only support a single [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS].[BR][BR]To start mining asteroids, [HS=HS_ShipMovement]Move[/HS] an Asteroid Miner to a belt of asteroids. The Asteroid Miner will set up a mine when it reaches the belt.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Research Asteroid Mining[BR]New Objective: Mine an Asteroid

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_UnlockedStarbaseTechOnObjective_Option0_0
StringTable.String: With the research into the Starbases [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS] complete, we can build [HS=HS_Constructor]Constructors[/HS] at a [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS]. [HS=HS_Constructor]Constructors[/HS] are used to build [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbases[/HS]. There are several types of [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbase[/HS] to take advantage of. Try building a few [HS=HS_Constructor]Constructors[/HS] at the [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS] and use them to build [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbases[/HS].[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Research Starbases[BR]New Objective: Build an Economic Starbase[BR]New Objective: Build a Military Starbase[BR]New Objective: Build a Mining Starbase[BR]New Objective: Build a Communications Starbase

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_UnlockedStarbaseTech_Option0_0
StringTable.String: With the research into the Starbases [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS] complete, we can build [HS=HS_Constructor]Constructors[/HS] at a [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS]. [HS=HS_Constructor]Constructors[/HS] are used to build [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbases[/HS]. There are several types of [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbase[/HS] to take advantage of. Try building a few [HS=HS_Constructor]Constructors[/HS] at the [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS] and use them to build [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbases[/HS].[BR][BR]New Objective: Build an Economic Starbase[BR]New Objective: Build a Military Starbase[BR]New Objective: Build a Mining Starbase[BR]New Objective: Build a Communications Starbase

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_SelectedConstructor_Option0_0
StringTable.String: [HS=HS_Constructor]Constructor[/HS] selected and ready for orders. Positioning for [HS=HS_Constructor]Constructors[/HS] is critical. [HS=HS_Constructor]Constructors[/HS] are consumed when a [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbases[/HS] is built.[BR][BR]To build a [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbase[/HS], press the [ICON=Order_ConstructStarbase] [HS=HS_ConstructStarbase]Construct Starbase[/HS] button by the selected panel. The [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbase[/HS] will be built at the [HS=HS_Constructor]Constructors[/HS] current position.[BR][BR]Keep in mind that [HS=HS_EconomicsStarbase]Economic Starbases[/HS] can only be built near [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core Worlds[/HS] and [HS=HS_MiningStarbase]Mining Starbases[/HS] can only be built near unclaimed [HS=HS_StrategicResource]Strategic Resources[/HS]. [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbases[/HS] can not be built too close to another [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbase[/HS], and they can not be built in another Civilizaton's [HS=HS_ZoneOfControl]Zone of Control[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_BuiltEconomicStarbase_Option0_0
StringTable.String: First [HS=HS_EconomicsStarbase]Economic Starbase[/HS] built. It will increase the [ICON=Manufacturing_Stat_Icon] [HS=HS_Manufacturing]Manufacturing[/HS] and [ICON=Stat_Income_Icon] [HS=HS_ColonyGrossIncome]Income[/HS] of Colonies within its area of influence.[BR][BR]Upgrades for [HS=HS_EconomicsStarbase]Economic Starbases[/HS] focus on further increasing the [ICON=Manufacturing_Stat_Icon] [HS=HS_Manufacturing]Manufacturing[/HS] or [ICON=Stat_Income_Icon] [HS=HS_ColonyGrossIncome]Income[/HS] of nearby Colonies. [HS=HS_EconomicsStarbase]Economic Starbases[/HS] are a great way to speed up the rate at which construction is completed without increasing [HS=HS_Pollution]Pollution[/HS]. To get a list of affected Colonies, press the Manage button by the selected panel for a [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbase[/HS].[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Build an Economic Starbase

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_BuiltMilitaryStarbase_Option0_0
StringTable.String: First [ICON=Icon_MiltaryStarbase] [HS=HS_MilitaryStarbase]Military Starbase[/HS] built. It will increase the Attack and Defense of all ships and fleets within its area of effect. These [ICON=Icon_MiltaryStarbase] [HS=HS_MilitaryStarbase]Military Starbases[/HS] also tend to get more defensive and weapon-focused upgrades than other [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbases[/HS].[BR][BR][ICON=Icon_MiltaryStarbase] [HS=HS_MilitaryStarbase]Military Starbases[/HS] are great when built in areas where conflict regularly occurs and around Colonies to help fend off assaults. To get a list of affected Colonies, press the Manage button by the selected panel for a [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbase[/HS].[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Build a Military Starbase

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_BuiltMiningStarbase_Option0_0
StringTable.String: First [HS=HS_MiningStarbase]Mining Starbase[/HS] built. Any unclaimed [HS=HS_StrategicResource]Strategic Resources[/HS] within the area of effect will be claimed by the new [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbase[/HS]. Each turn, the [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbase[/HS] will add an amount of the mined [HS=HS_StrategicResource]Strategic Resources[/HS] to the Alliance's available resources. The amount mined can be increased by researching and applying upgrades to [HS=HS_MiningStarbase]Mining Starbases[/HS][BR][BR][HS=HS_StrategicResource]Strategic Resources[/HS] are important for constructing certain Planetary Improvements and Ships along with making certain upgrades.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Build Mining Starbase

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_BuiltCommunicationsStarbase_Option0_0
StringTable.String: First [ICON=Icon_CommunicationsStarbase] [HS=HS_CommunicationsStarbase]Communications Starbase[/HS] built. The [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbase[/HS] will begin to increase [ICON=Stat_Influence_Icon] [HS=HS_Influence]Influence[/HS]. [ICON=Icon_CommunicationsStarbase] [HS=HS_CommunicationsStarbase]Communications Starbases[/HS] are good for trying to lay early claim to an area or attempt to resist the spread of another Civilization's [ICON=Stat_Influence_Icon] [HS=HS_Influence]Influence[/HS] to keep their [HS=HS_ZoneOfControl]Zone of Control[/HS] under control.[BR][BR] If a Colony ends up in another Civilization's [HS=HS_ZoneOfControl]Zone of Control[/HS], it becomes at risk of being annexed. Each turn spent in a foreign [HS=HS_ZoneOfControl]Zone of Control[/HS] reduces control over a Colony until it is annexed or the Colony brought back into your [HS=HS_ZoneOfControl]Zone of Control[/HS].[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Build a Communications Starbase

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_CompletedStarbase_Option0_0
StringTable.String: With the [ICON=Icon_EconomicsStarbase] [HS=HS_EconomicsStarbase]Economic Starbase[/HS] complete the nearby [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS] will gain a boost to its economy. The [HS=HS_EconomicsStarbase]Economic Starbase[/HS] is only one of the [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbase[/HS] types that can be built. Each type has its own purpose worth taking time to understand.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Build an Economic Starbase

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_CompletedStarbaseStartAsteroidMining_Option0_0
