StringTable.String: With the [ICON=Icon_EconomicsStarbase] [HS=HS_EconomicsStarbase]Economic Starbase[/HS] complete the nearby [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS] will gain a boost to its economy. The [HS=HS_EconomicsStarbase]Economic Starbase[/HS] is only one of the [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbase[/HS] types that can be built. Each type has its own purpose worth taking time to understand.[BR][BR]Another method to benefit [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS] is through Asteroid Mining. This requires the Asteroid Mining [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS], available in the [HS=HS_ResearchCenter]Research Center[/HS].[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Build an Economic Starbase[BR]New Objective: Research Asteroid Mining

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_MinedAnAsteroid_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Mine established. Asteroid Miners are consumed to set up the mining station. When a mining station is developed, it claims the entire Asteroid Belt and begins to send resources to the nearest [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS].[BR][BR]Increasing the [ICON=Manufacturing_Stat_Icon] [HS=HS_Manufacturing]Manufacturing[/HS] of a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS] increases how quickly improvements are completed and ships constructed. A [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS] has several types of input like [HS=HS_Minerals]Minerals[/HS], each input representing a type of resource available to the planet that positively impacts the Planetary Output.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Mine an Asteroid

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_GuideToShipyard_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Before you end your [HS=HS_Months]Turn[/HS], make sure the [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS] is working on constructing a new ship.[BR][BR]A [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS] can't be allowed to idle and must be working on something at the end of every [HS=HS_Months]Turn[/HS]. While all available options are valid, it'd be wise to construct additional Probes to speed up our exploration of the [HS=HS_Sector]Sector[/HS].[BR][BR]To start constructing a new Ship, access the [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS] by selecting it and then pressing the [ICON=Menu_ShipyardManagement_Icon] Management button by the selection panel. [BR][BR]How many [HS=HS_Months] Turns [/HS] it takes to complete a ship or project is influenced by the [ICON=Manufacturing_Stat_Icon] [HS=HS_Manufacturing]Manufacturing[/HS] value on the [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS] the [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS] orbits.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_OpenedShipyardScreen_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Welcome to the Shipyard Management Window. On this screen, you can add ships to the Build Queue. Each [HS=HS_Months]Turn[/HS] the [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS] will add progress to the ship at the front of the queue until it is complete, at which point it will be spawned into the [HS=HS_Sector]Sector[/HS] next to the [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS].[BR][BR]The number of [HS=HS_Months]Turns[/HS] remaining can be seen on the ship's card in the queue. How long a ship takes from the start is listed on its entry in the Available Projects panel on the side of the screen. Select a ship in the Available Projects and press the Build Ship button to add a Ship to the queue. You can also add ships by Double-Clicking on the ship.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_ExplainCitizens_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Citizens are vital to helping a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS] function effectively. Citizens have stats that help improve Planetary Output. To train a Citizen, select them with the LEFT Mouse Button and then select a job.[BR][BR]Citizens work better when kept happy. Check on their [ICON=Approval_Stat_Icon] [HS=HS_Approval]Approval[/HS] often. Hover the Mouse over their [ICON=Approval_Stat_Icon] [HS=HS_Approval]Approval[/HS] icon to get a breakdown of what is affecting them.[BR][BR]Colonies will produce new Citizens as long as [ICON=Stat_Food_Icon] [HS=HS_Food]Food[/HS] is available and [HS=HS_Pollution]Pollution[/HS] isn't too high. You can see the projected number of [HS=HS_Months]Turns[/HS] based on the current state of the [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_StartColonization_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Thanks to your efforts, the Alliance has made many notable advancements toward expanding across the [HS=HS_Sector]Sector[/HS]. To truly develop, we must start [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonizing[/HS] new planets.[BR][BR]The research team believes we can create ships perfect for such an effort with the proper advancements. The Colonization [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS] will unlock the ability to construct Colony Ships. Return to the [HS=HS_ResearchCenter]Research Center[/HS] to ensure that the [ICON=Stat_Research_Icon] [HS=HS_Research]Research[/HS] generated each [HS=HS_Months]Turn[/HS] goes toward Colonizing.[BR][BR]New Objective: Research Colonization

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_ResearchedColonizationOnObjective_Option0_0
StringTable.String: We should start working to expand the Alliance's borders. The next step is constructing a Colony Ship at a [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS].[BR][BR][HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyards[/HS] can only be constructed from [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core Worlds[/HS]. The speed at which a [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS] can produce ships is influenced by the associated [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World's[/HS] [ICON=Manufacturing_Stat_Icon] [HS=HS_Manufacturing]Manufacturing[/HS].[BR][BR]To start constructing a new Ship, access the [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS] by selecting it and then pressing the [ICON=Menu_ShipyardManagement_Icon] Management button by the selection panel.[BR][BR]New Objective: Construct a Colony Ship

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_ResearchedColonization_Option0_0
StringTable.String: We should start working to expand the Alliance's borders. The next step is constructing a Colony Ship at a [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS].[BR][BR][HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyards[/HS] can only be constructed from [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core Worlds[/HS]. The speed at which a [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS] can produce ships is influenced by the associated [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World's[/HS] [ICON=Manufacturing_Stat_Icon] [HS=HS_Manufacturing]Manufacturing[/HS].[BR][BR]To start constructing a new Ship, access the [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS] by selecting it and then pressing the [ICON=Menu_ShipyardManagement_Icon] Management button by the selection panel.[BR][BR]New Objective: Construct a Colony Ship

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_ConstructedColonyShip_Option0_0
StringTable.String: A Colony Ship is constructed but can only be deployed once a Citizen staffs it. A Colony must always have one Citizen. You cannot put a Citizen on a Colony Ship if they're the only working Citizen on the planet. When a Colony Ship is finished or attempts to leave the orbit, you will need to ensure there is a Citizen on it.[BR][BR]You can check on your Citizens and how quickly their number is increasing on the [ICON=Menu_PlanetManagement_Icon] [HS=HS_PlanetManagement]Planet Management Window[/HS].[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Construct a Colony Ship[BR]New Objective: Colonize a Planet

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_SelectedColonyShip_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Colony Ship selected and ready for orders. Directing a Colony Ship to [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonize[/HS] a planet is much like giving any order. With a Colony Ship selected, select a planet to [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonize[/HS] with the RIGHT Mouse Button.[BR][BR]The Colony Ship will then move toward the planet, and once at the destination, it will attempt to [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonize[/HS] the targeted planet.[BR][BR]Not all Planets can be [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonized[/HS]. A Planet must have a [HS=HS_PlanetClass]Class[/HS] of 1 or greater. You can check a Planet's [HS=HS_PlanetClass]Class[/HS] by hovering the Mouse over the planet.[BR][BR]Mars is a perfect candidate to [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonize[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_ColonizedFirstPlanetNormal_Option0_0
StringTable.String: One giant step for the Terran Alliance.[BR][BR]Now that we have proven it can [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonize[/HS] new worlds, it's time to expand truly.[BR][BR]It will take an effort combining what we've managed to establish to construct new Colony Ships and [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonize[/HS] more planets. The effort will be well worth it as more planets provide the Alliance with more resources.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Colonize a Planet[BR]New Objective: Colonize 8 Planets

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_ColonizedFirstPlanetCoreWorld_Option0_0
StringTable.String: One giant step for the Alliance.[BR][BR]The Alliance has [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonized[/HS] its first world, one large enough to support a larger Colony and become a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS]. Many planets are too minor or lack the resources to justify making it a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS]. So when a planet large enough is settled, it should be taken full advantage of.[BR][BR][HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core Worlds[/HS] can support a [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS] and be improved, but that requires a [HS=HS_Leaders]Leader[/HS] to be assigned as a [HS=HS_Governor]Governor[/HS].[BR][BR]A [HS=HS_Leaders]Leader[/HS] can be assigned from the [ICON=Menu_PlanetManagement_Icon] [HS=HS_PlanetManagement]Planet Management Window[/HS] available by selecting the planet.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Colonize a Planet[BR]New Objective: Colonize 8 Planets[BR]New Objective: Appoint a Governor

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_ColonizedNewPlanetNormal_Option0_0
StringTable.String: When choosing planets to [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonize[/HS], hovering the Mouse over a planet can provide vital information. [BR][BR]First is [HS=HS_PlanetClass]Planet Class[/HS]; this represents the amount of space available for development on a planet. Any planet with a [HS=HS_PlanetClass]Planet Class[/HS] over 10 can be turned into a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS], which vastly expands the Alliance's capabilities.[BR][BR]Another factor is the provided resources. All [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonizable[/HS] planets send resources to the nearest [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS] as Planetary Input to increase the [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World's[/HS] Planetary Output.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_ColonizedNewPlanetCoreWorld_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Commander, we've [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonized[/HS] a planet with a [HS=HS_PlanetClass]Planet Class[/HS] high enough to establish a new [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS]. [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core Worlds[/HS] can support a [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS] and be developed to provide the Alliance with additional Planetary Output. More Planetary Output means more of the vital resources that keep the Alliance moving forward.[BR][BR]To establish a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS], a [HS=HS_Leaders]Leader[/HS] must be assigned as a [HS=HS_Governor]Governor[/HS]. [HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] can be hired and assigned through the [HS=HS_LeaderMenu]Leaders Menu[/HS] or hired more directly by pressing the [ICON=Menu_PlanetManagement_Icon] [HS=HS_PlanetManagement]Planet Management[/HS] button.[BR][BR]New Objective: Assign a Governor

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_ColonizedThirdPlanet_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Keeping an expanding civilization fed can be a challenge. While [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonizing[/HS] new planets and building Improvements on our [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core Worlds[/HS], it's best to keep in mind how much [ICON=Stat_Food_Icon] [HS=HS_Food]Food[/HS] is being produced versus being consumed. You can check the current rate of production versus the current rate of consumption by hovering the Mouse over the [ICON=Stat_Food_Icon] [HS=HS_Food]Food[/HS] stat on the top resource bar.[BR][BR] [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonizing[/HS] planets with high [ICON=Stat_Fertility_Icon] [HS=HS_Farming]Farming[/HS] is one way to boost the amount of food produced from a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS]. Another way is to construct Improvements on a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS] that boosts the amount of [ICON=Stat_Food_Icon] [HS=HS_Food]Food[/HS] produced.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_ColonizedFourthPlanet_Option0_0
StringTable.String: A benefit to expanding to other planets is finding additional resources and space to improve [ICON=Stat_Research_Icon] [HS=HS_Research]Research[/HS], which speeds up how quickly we unlock new [HS=HS_Tech]Techs[/HS].[BR][BR][ICON=Stat_Technology_Icon] [HS=HS_Technology]Technology[/HS] provided as Planetary Input by a [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonized[/HS] planet increases [ICON=Stat_Research_Icon] [HS=HS_Research]Research[/HS] on a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS]. In addition, Improvements can be built on [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS] to increase the [ICON=Stat_Research_Icon] [HS=HS_Research]Research[/HS] that planet provides.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_ColonizedFifthPlanet_Option0_0
StringTable.String: [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonizing[/HS] new planets doesn't just provide resources, it expands the Alliance's [HS=HS_ZoneOfControl]Zone of Control[/HS]. The [HS=HS_ZoneOfControl]Zone of Control[/HS] represents sections of space that are considered part of a Civilization, essentially establishing a border.[BR][BR]There are specific actions, like building [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbases[/HS], that can not be done in another Civilization's [HS=HS_ZoneOfControl]Zone of Control[/HS]. Other actions, like Asteroid Mining, can only be done within the [HS=HS_ZoneOfControl]Zone of Control[/HS].[BR][BR]The [HS=HS_ZoneOfControl]Zone of Control[/HS] expands naturally over time based on the [ICON=Stat_Influence_Icon] [HS=HS_Influence]Influence[/HS] of [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core Worlds[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_ColonizedCoreworld_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Commander, we've [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonized[/HS] a planet with a [HS=HS_PlanetClass]Planet Class[/HS] high enough to establish a new [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS]. [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core Worlds[/HS] can support a [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS] and be developed to provide the Alliance with additional Planetary Output. [BR][BR]To establish a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS], a [HS=HS_Leaders]Leader[/HS] must be assigned as a [HS=HS_Governor]Governor[/HS]. [HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] can be hired and assigned through the [HS=HS_LeaderMenu]Leaders Menu[/HS] or hired more directly by pressing the [ICON=Menu_PlanetManagement_Icon] [HS=HS_PlanetManagement]Planet Management[/HS] button.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Colonize a Class 10 or Greater Planet[BR]New Objective: Assign a Governor

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_ColonizeTargetPlanets_Option0_0
StringTable.String: The Terran Alliance has claimed many planets through [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonization[/HS]. Our proficiency and capabilities continue to expand thanks to your efforts.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Colonize 8 Planets

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_ColonizeTargetPlanetsLastCoreworld_Option0_0
StringTable.String: The Terran Alliance alliance was charged with colonizing planets to secure humanity's foothold in space. None can contest the Alliance's competency with all the planets successfully [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonized[/HS]. Take a moment to revel in this accomplishment.[BR][BR]You've also settled your first planet large enough to establish a new [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS]![BR][BR]Many planets aren't large enough to allow colonies to expand. Planets too small to support a [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS] are well-suited for supporting larger colonies. These smaller colonies don't require any additional leadership or management. [BR][BR]Due to their rarity, taking advantage of any planet resource-rich enough to justify larger colonies is advisable. To do so, a [HS=HS_Leaders]Leader[/HS] must be assigned as a [HS=HS_Governor]Governor[/HS] to the planet. Once a [HS=HS_Governor]Governor[/HS] is appointed, a [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS] can be built over the planet, and the planet can be developed to better utilize the resources.[BR][BR][HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] can be recruited from the [ICON=Menu_Leader_Icon] [HS=HS_LeaderMenu]Leaders Menu[/HS] under the [HS=HS_RecruitmentScreen]Recruitment Screen[/HS]. Recruited [HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] can then be assigned to manage planets under the [HS=HS_GovernorsScreen]Governors Screen[/HS].[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Colonize 8 Planets[BR]New Objective: Appoint a Governor

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_ColonzieTargetWorldsNoCoreworld_Option0_0
StringTable.String: The Terran Alliance has claimed many planets through [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonization[/HS]. Our proficiency and capabilities continue to expand thanks to your efforts.[BR][BR]Through our efforts, though, we've yet to [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonize[/HS] a planet large enough to establish a new [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS]. Establishing a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS] is now a priority for the Alliance.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Colonize 8 Planets[BR]New Objective: Colonize a Class 10 or Greater Planet

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_UnlockCultureTrait_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Commander, we've earned enough [HS=HS_CulturePoint]Culture Points[/HS] to unlock a Cultural Trait. Specific Planetary improvements allow us to produce [HS=HS_CulturePoint]Culture Points[/HS], such as the Capital City.[BR][BR]Every Civilization has an affinity toward certain [HS=HS_Ideology]Ideologies[/HS]. Affinities can change over time based on decisions made and actions taken.[BR][BR]The [ICON=Menu_CulturalProgression_Icon] button for the Cultural Progression Menu to spend [HS=HS_CulturePoint]Culture Points[/HS] is located on the action bar at the bottom of the screen.[BR][BR]New Objective: Unlock a Cultural Trait

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_OpenedCultureScreen_Option0_0
StringTable.String: You've accessed the Cultural Progression screen. This screen is where you can check through the various Ideology trees. To learn about a Cultural Trait, hover the Mouse over the Cultural Trait; the context card will give information on the effects of the Cultural Trait and the current [HS=HS_CulturePoint]Culture Points[/HS] cost.[BR][BR]If you have enough [HS=HS_CulturePoint]Culture Points[/HS], you can unlock a Cultural Trait to gain its benefits. With an Ideology selected, you can also see the Ideology Discount at the top of the screen, representing your affinity for that [HS=HS_Ideology]Ideology[/HS]. You can earn more [HS=HS_CulturePoint]Culture Points[/HS] by constructing certain Planetary Improvements.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_UnlockedCultureTrait_Option0_0
StringTable.String: As a Civilization grows, it takes more [HS=HS_CulturePoint]Culture Points[/HS] to unlock Cultural Traits. Focusing on a specific [HS=HS_Ideology]Ideology[/HS] and increasing affinity toward that [HS=HS_Ideology]Ideology[/HS] is an excellent way to bring the [HS=HS_CulturePoint]Culture Point[/HS] cost down and unlock the more beneficial traits quicker.[BR][BR]You can check the Cultural Progression screen to see how many [HS=HS_CulturePoint]Culture Points[/HS] are available, the current Ideology Discount of an [HS=HS_Ideology]Ideology[/HS], how many [HS=HS_CulturePoint]Culture Points[/HS] a new Cultural Trait costs or confirm the benefits of previously unlocked Cultural Traits.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Unlock a Cultural Trait

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_InstalledGovernor_Option0_0
StringTable.String: You've successfully assigned a [HS=HS_Governor]Governor[/HS]! Their presence turns the Colony into a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS] where a [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS] can be built and the planet developed.[BR][BR]New [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core Worlds[/HS] take time to develop as they often start with low Planetary Output and few resources. Utilizing [HS=HS_EconomicsStarbase]Economic Starbases[/HS], [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonizing[/HS] nearby planets, and mining asteroids are all ways to increase [ICON=Manufacturing_Stat_Icon] [HS=HS_Manufacturing]Manufacturing[/HS] and speed up development. You can also expend [ICON=Stat_Credits_Icon] [HS=HS_Credit]Credits[/HS] to [HS=HS_Rush]Rush[/HS] construction.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Appoint a Governor

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_InformPlayerUnlockedLeaderScreen_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Commander, we now have access to [HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS]. Every applicant has strengths and weaknesses, making them more or less suitable for any role.[BR][BR][HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] can serve in several positions, but before assigning them, they need to be hired. To hire [HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] open the [ICON=Menu_Leader_Icon] [HS=HS_LeaderMenu]Leaders Menu[/HS]. The button for the [ICON=Menu_Leader_Icon] [HS=HS_LeaderMenu]Leaders Menu[/HS] is located on the action bar at the bottom of the screen.[BR][BR]New Objective: Hire 2 Leaders

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_OpenedLeaderScreen_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Here in the [ICON=Menu_Leader_Icon] [HS=HS_LeaderMenu]Leaders Menu[/HS] are multiple tabs. To hire new [HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] focus on the [HS=HS_RecruitmentScreen]Recruitment[/HS] tab. Available candidates will be listed on the screen here with how many [HS=HS_Months]Turns[/HS] they will be available for recruitment and their relevant stats. Any role a [HS=HS_Leaders]Leader[/HS] takes will benefit from specific stats, but no role requires a [HS=HS_Leaders]Leader[/HS] to be proficient in all skills. So a low stat or two does not mean a [HS=HS_Leaders]Leader[/HS] will be ineffective.[BR][BR]To Hire a [HS=HS_Leaders]Leader[/HS] you will need to have enough [ICON=Stat_Credits_Icon] [HS=HS_Credit]Credits[/HS]. [ICON=Stat_Credits_Icon] [HS=HS_Credit]Credits[/HS] are gained over time based on the [ICON=Stat_Income_Icon] [HS=HS_ColonyGrossIncome]Income[/HS] of all [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core Worlds[/HS]. To hire a [HS=HS_Leaders]Leader[/HS], double-click on them with the LEFT Mouse Button.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_HiredTargetLeaders_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Leaders hired and ready for duty. There are many ways a [HS=HS_Leaders]Leader[/HS] can serve, but a great way to benefit the entire Alliance is to assign [HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] as [HS=HS_Minister]Ministers[/HS].[BR][BR][HS=HS_Minister]Ministers[/HS] oversee specific aspects of a Civilization and provide a benefit based on a specific stat. See available offices in the [HS=HS_LeaderMenu]Leaders Menu[/HS] under the [HS=HS_MinistersScreen]Ministers[/HS] tab. Hovering the Mouse over a [HS=HS_Minister]Ministers[/HS] Office will provide additional information about the Office. Assign [HS=HS_Minister]Ministers[/HS] by dragging and dropping [HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] with the LEFT Mouse Button.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Hire 2 Leaders[BR]New Objective: Appoint 3 Ministers

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_CabinetFilled_Option0_0
StringTable.String: You've successfully appointed several [HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] into roles as [HS=HS_Minister]Ministers[/HS]. Their support will go a long way to assisting the Alliance. As you recruit new [HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] or existing [HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders'[/HS] skills change, you can always change what role a [HS=HS_Leaders]Leader[/HS] has from the [ICON=Menu_Leader_Icon] [HS=HS_LeaderMenu]Leaders Menu[/HS].[BR][BR]All [HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] have strengths and weaknesses, so checking your [HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] can go a long way. More [HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] will become available for hire as [HS=HS_Months]Turns[/HS] pass.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Appoint 3 Ministers

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_CabinetFilledUnlockedPolicyScreen_Option0_0
StringTable.String: You've successfully appointed several [HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] into roles as [HS=HS_Minister]Ministers[/HS]. Their support will go a long way to assisting in exploring the galaxy, settling new planets, and the expansion of the Terran Alliance's Influence. As you recruit new [HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] or their skills change, you can always change what role a [HS=HS_Leaders]Leader[/HS] has from the [ICON=Menu_Leader_Icon] [HS=HS_LeaderMenu]Leaders Menu[/HS].[BR][BR]There are other ways to benefit the entire Alliance. [HS=HS_Policy]Policies[/HS] are rules that can be issued to affect all colonies and fleets. The appropriate [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS] is already unlocked by researching Colonial Policies. Now, a [HS=HS_Policy]Policies[/HS] can be enacted in the [ICON=Menu_CivilizationMenu_Icon] [HS=HS_CivilizationMenu]Civilization Menu[/HS].[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Appoint 3 Ministers[BR]New Objective: Enact a Policy

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_CabinetFilledEnactedAPolicy_Option0_0
StringTable.String: You've successfully appointed several [HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] into roles as [HS=HS_Minister]Ministers[/HS]. Their support will go a long way to assisting in exploring the galaxy, settling new planets, and the expansion of the Terran Alliance's Influence. As you recruit new [HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] or their skills change, you can always change what role a [HS=HS_Leaders]Leader[/HS] has from the [ICON=Menu_Leader_Icon] [HS=HS_LeaderMenu]Leaders Menu[/HS].[BR][BR]There are other ways to benefit the entire Alliance. [HS=HS_Policy]Policies[/HS] are rules that can be issued to affect all colonies and fleets. You've already unlocked the [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS] to access [HS=HS_Policy]Policies[/HS] and enacted one. Remember that you can change [HS=HS_Policy]Policies[/HS] to better suit the civilization's current needs in the [ICON=Menu_CivilizationMenu_Icon] [HS=HS_CivilizationMenu]Civilization Menu[/HS].[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Appoint 3 Ministers

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_GuideToUnlockPolicyScreen_Option0_0
StringTable.String: As the Alliance grows, so should its tools for management. We'll need to complete some additional research to develop the infrastructure to manage the Alliance better.[BR][BR]The Colonial Policies [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS] will unlock the ability to access the [ICON=Menu_CivilizationMenu_Icon] [HS=HS_CivilizationMenu]Civilization Menu[/HS]. From the [ICON=Menu_CivilizationMenu_Icon] [HS=HS_CivilizationMenu]Civilization Menu[/HS], it will be possible to manage [HS=HS_Taxes]Taxes[/HS] for the entire Alliance, get an overview of the cumulative Planetary Output, and even enact [HS=HS_Policy]Policies[/HS].[BR][BR]New Objective: Research Colonial Policies

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_UnlockedPolicyScreen_Option0_0
StringTable.String: The research into Colonial Policies is complete. You can now access the [ICON=Menu_CivilizationMenu_Icon] [HS=HS_CivilizationMenu]Civilization Menu[/HS]. The [ICON=Menu_CivilizationMenu_Icon] [HS=HS_CivilizationMenu]Civilization Menu[/HS] provides plenty of useful information and it allows you to enact [HS=HS_Policy]Policies[/HS] that affect the entire Alliance.[BR][BR]You can open the [ICON=Menu_CivilizationMenu_Icon] [HS=HS_CivilizationMenu]Civilization Menu[/HS] by pressing the [ICON=Menu_CivilizationMenu_Icon] [HS=HS_CivilizationMenu]Civilization Menu[/HS] button on the action bar.[BR][BR]Complete Objective: Research Colonial Policies[BR]New Objective: Enact a Policy

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_UnlockedPolicyScreenNotObjective_Option0_0
StringTable.String: The research into Colonial Policies is complete. You can now access the [ICON=Menu_CivilizationMenu_Icon] [HS=HS_CivilizationMenu]Civilization Menu[/HS]. The [ICON=Menu_CivilizationMenu_Icon] [HS=HS_CivilizationMenu]Civilization Menu[/HS] provides plenty of useful information and it allows you to enact [HS=HS_Policy]Policies[/HS] that affect the entire Alliance.[BR][BR]You can open the [ICON=Menu_CivilizationMenu_Icon] [HS=HS_CivilizationMenu]Civilization Menu[/HS] by pressing the [ICON=Menu_CivilizationMenu_Icon] [HS=HS_CivilizationMenu]Civilization Menu[/HS] button on the action bar.[BR][BR]New Objective: Enact a Policy

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_OpenedPolicyScreen_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Here in the [ICON=Menu_CivilizationMenu_Icon] [HS=HS_CivilizationMenu]Civilization Menu[/HS], you have access to a few tools to manage the entire Civilization better. You can adjust the [HS=HS_Taxes]Tax Rate[/HS] which directly affects [ICON=Approval_Stat_Icon] [HS=HS_Approval]Approval[/HS] and the change in [ICON=Stat_Credits_Icon] [HS=HS_Credit]Credits[/HS] each [HS=HS_Months]Turn[/HS].[BR][BR]You can also now enact a [HS=HS_Policy]Policy[/HS]. [HS=HS_Policy]Policies[/HS] are a way to issue a command that will affect every Colony, Citizen, [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleet[/HS], and sometimes more. You can unlock additional Policy Slots by researching certain [HS=HS_Tech]Techs[/HS].[BR][BR]To enact a [HS=HS_Policy]Policy[/HS], choose a [HS=HS_Policy]Policy[/HS] from the Available Policy panel then drag and drop it into an unlocked slot.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_EnactedAPolicy_Option0_0
StringTable.String: You've successfully enacted a [HS=HS_Policy]Policy[/HS]. The change will be carried out as quickly as possible![BR][BR]Keep in mind that [HS=HS_Policy]Policies[/HS] can be changed anytime during your turn to better suit changing goals or respond to specific issues.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Enact a Policy

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesSpotted_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Commander, it's been confirmed that the [HS=HS_Pirates]Pirates[/HS] have established a [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS] in the [HS=HS_Sector]Sector[/HS]. The problem is likely only to get worse.[BR][BR]Not only do the [HS=HS_Pirates]Pirates[/HS] threaten our fleets and colonies, but they give the Terran Alliance a bad reputation. We should remove their ability to create more ships to manage this issue quickly.[BR][BR]New Objective: Destroy a Pirate Shipyard

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_FighterSelected_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Fighter selected and ready for orders![BR][BR]Fighters come in many forms with different hull types, weapons, and armor. Their primary purpose is to defend and attack. They can be ordered to [HS=HS_ShipMovement]Move[/HS] to colonies or Starbases where they'll move into orbit and serve as defenders if any hostile fleet attempts to attack the location.[BR][BR]To order ships to attack, select a target with the RIGHT Mouse Button. The target will become the destination of the chosen ship's movement. Once in an adjacent tile, combat can take place.[BR][BR][HS=HS_Fleet]Fleets[/HS] perform better in combat than lone fighters. To create a [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleet[/HS] move ships onto the same tile, if they have enough [ICON=ShipLogistics_Icon] [HS=HS_Logistics]Logistics[/HS] the ships will join up automatically.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_LostAFight_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Commander, we've lost a conflict.[BR][BR]In the future, we can improve our odds of victory by putting our ships into [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleets[/HS]. Form [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleets[/HS] by [HS=HS_ShipMovement]Moving[/HS] Ships onto the same tile. A [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleet[/HS] is restricted in size by its [ICON=ShipLogistics_Icon] [HS=HS_Logistics]Logistics[/HS], so if a [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleet[/HS] isn't forming or expanding, the [ICON=ShipLogistics_Icon] [HS=HS_Logistics]Logistics[/HS] score is too high.[BR][BR]Additionally, control when fights occur by staying on the offensive. Initiate battles heavily weighted in our favor to weaken enemies. Avoid fleets too powerful to quickly take down and utilize distance tactics such as the Beam Volley and Missile Volley.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_GuideToRushImprovement_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Sometimes, especially during conflict, waiting a few [HS=HS_Months]Months[/HS] for something to finish isn't an option. In those scenarios, many projects and constructions can be [HS=HS_Rush]Rushed[/HS]. [HS=HS_Rush]Rushing[/HS] costs [ICON=Stat_Credits_Icon] [HS=HS_Credit]Credits[/HS], often a good deal of them, but it will reduce the time required to complete something to 1 [HS=HS_Months]Month[/HS].[BR][BR]Some colonies are worried that conflict will take too much attention and resources. Alleviate their concerns by [HS=HS_Rush]Rushing[/HS] a planetary improvement to show them they're still remembered, and the Alliance continues to be invested in developing its worlds.[BR][BR]To [HS=HS_Rush]Rush[/HS] a Planetary Improvement, select a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS] and open the Management window. Selecting any item in the Build Queue with the LEFT Mouse Button will bring up some contextual options. Among those is the [HS=HS_Rush]Rush[/HS] option. As long as you have the [ICON=Stat_Control_Icon] [HS=HS_Control]Control[/HS] and [ICON=Stat_Credits_Icon] [HS=HS_Credit]Credits[/HS] required, selecting the [HS=HS_Rush]Rush[/HS] option will [HS=HS_Rush]Rush[/HS] the specific improvement. The [HS=HS_Rush]Rush[/HS] option will be grayed out and unresponsive if you do not have the necessary resources.[BR][BR]New Objective: Rush a Planetary Improvement

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_RushedImprovement_Option0_0
StringTable.String: The citizens of the Alliance will appreciate the resources invested in their work. Great job.[BR][BR]It will be essential to know that [HS=HS_Rush]Rush[/HS] can only be used once per Colony and once per [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS] in a [HS=HS_Months]Month[/HS]. That is on top of the often hefty price required. [HS=HS_Rush]Rushing[/HS] is best used to gain a drastic advantage or swiftly respond to an issue.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Rush a Planetary Improvement

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_GuideToExecutiveOrder_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Over time, the Alliance gains Control, a resource for exerting your will. [ICON=Stat_Control_Icon] [HS=HS_Control]Control[/HS] can be spent in several ways, one beneficial way being with [ICON=Menu_ExecutiveOrders_Icon] [HS=HS_ExecutiveOrders]Executive Orders[/HS].[BR][BR][ICON=Menu_ExecutiveOrders_Icon] [HS=HS_ExecutiveOrders]Executive Order[/HS] are abilities that can have various impacts. They can be beneficial in all types of scenarios. The Draft Colonists order may be the most helpful as the Alliance expands. To use an [ICON=Menu_ExecutiveOrders_Icon] [HS=HS_ExecutiveOrders]Executive Order[/HS], start by hovering the Mouse over the [ICON=Menu_ExecutiveOrders_Icon] [HS=HS_ExecutiveOrders]Executive Order[/HS] option and then use the LEFT Mouse Button to select an order.[BR][BR]New Objective: Use an Executive Order

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_UsedExecutiveOrder_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Success![BR][BR]Your [ICON=Menu_ExecutiveOrders_Icon] [HS=HS_ExecutiveOrders]Executive Order[/HS] has been carried out. On top of the Cost, most [ICON=Menu_ExecutiveOrders_Icon] [HS=HS_ExecutiveOrders]Executive Orders[/HS] have a Cooldown time, measuring the number of [HS=HS_Months]Turns[/HS] that must pass before the [ICON=Menu_ExecutiveOrders_Icon] [HS=HS_ExecutiveOrders]Executive Order[/HS] can be used again. Ensuring there's enough [ICON=Stat_Control_Icon] [HS=HS_Control]Control[/HS] accruing from [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core Worlds[/HS] is always a good idea so that [ICON=Menu_ExecutiveOrders_Icon] [HS=HS_ExecutiveOrders]Executive Orders[/HS] can be utilized when needed.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Use an Executive Order

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PirateShipyardDestroyed_Option0_0
StringTable.String: The [HS=HS_Pirates]Pirate's[/HS] base of operations in this [HS=HS_Sector]Sector[/HS] has been destroyed. There may be a few stragglers, but their presence in this [HS=HS_Sector]Sector[/HS] will wane without the ability to create more ships.[BR][BR]Great work. The Terran Alliance is closer to establishing a solid foothold in this Sector.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Destroy a Pirate Shipyard

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_NeedsUnlockLeaderScreen_Option0_0
StringTable.String: As the Terran Alliance's influence expands, we'll need competent [HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS]. [HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] can help manage [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core Worlds[/HS], serve as [HS=HS_Minister]Ministers[/HS] that benefit the entire Alliance, and more. The Alliance needs to ensure the infrastructure is in place to recruit [HS=HS_Leaders]Leader[/HS]. This can be done by completing the Colonial Leadership Project on a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS].[BR][BR]New Objective: Complete the Colonial Leadership Project

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_MAIN_Option254_0
StringTable.String: Vuresef, {PLAYERFACTION:2}. Tipot {PLAYERFACTION:1}'s orisih beha rinin holares. Erasuto ki nakeduc menurit! (You need to research Universal Translator)

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_MAIN_Option255_0
StringTable.String: A smooth-skinned biped stares back at us from the view screen. Wearing some kind of lightly ceremonial garb, it jabbers a short series of unintelligible grunting sounds. Getting no response from us, it gestures at someone off screen in a manner which suggests annoyance. They can't seem to understand us either.[BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_MAIN_Option256_0
StringTable.String: Our screen flickers for a minute before the video emerges, filled with an image of a massive insectoid creature. [BR][BR]Motionless at first, its only a slight waver of its vicious pincers which indicate the creature is alive as it glares back at us. In the background, more of its kind move around, clicking and chittering at each other. A language of some kind, but it's impossible to determine what they're saying.[BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_MAIN_Option257_0
StringTable.String: A curious creature stares back at us from the screen. Ten or twelve legged, in the manner of a segmented insect, the creature also appears to have a lightly armored exoskeleton.[BR][BR]From its long, dexterous tongue, a series of subtle hissing noises emerges. It seems to be trying to communicate with us, but it's of no use.[BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_MAIN_Option258_0
StringTable.String: A small, furry creature appears on screen. With its soft fur and enormous eyes, the being looks cute, and possibly delicious. Its eyes widen even further, perhaps realizing what we're thinking.[BR][BR]Eventually it opens its small, delicate mouth and emits a series of mewling noises. A speech of sorts, though who knows what it means. Something adorable, no doubt.[BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_MAIN_Option259_0
StringTable.String: A green skinned biped appears on screen, wearing elaborate clothes and a headdress. Likely a female, if this species has the same notion of genders as we do, which may be a dangerous guess.[BR][BR] The creature utters something in their native tongue, unintelligible, yet somehow very, very compelling.[BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_MAIN_Option260_0
StringTable.String: A ferocious looking humanoid fills the screen, glaring at you from behind green eyes. You can feel the contempt dripping from him, though he says nothing.[BR][BR]It murmurs something, almost below the range of hearing, and flicker of strange text crosses the screen, as the alien's communications systems try and fail to interface with ours. There will be no talking with this creature today.[BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_MAIN_Option261_0
StringTable.String: A cruel looking green skinned biped appears, glaring at us. Wearing armor of some kind, and baring its teeth, it gives every impression that it is a warrior, or at least wishes to be perceived as one.[BR][BR]It barks something angrily at the screen, and you wonder for a moment if it's truly a bad thing we can't understand what its saying.[BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_MAIN_Option262_0
StringTable.String: A slender, blue skinned biped appears, delicate in feature and manner. It speaks calmly at us in a strange yet somehow noble speech.[BR][BR]Seeing no recognition in our response, it nods its head slowly, having realized the communication barrier that exists. If anything, it seems disappointed in us.[BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_MAIN_Option263_0
StringTable.String: A metallic creature appears on screen, unblinking red sensors staring back at us. The sensors iris open a bit, before narrowing, the creature studying us.[BR][BR]Sound emerges from it, a clash of discordant sounds, almost as if its trying different languages on us to see if we understand anything. We don't. The sensors narrow even further. There's no point communicating with this being now.[BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_MAIN_Option264_0
StringTable.String: A small biped appears on screen, staring at us. It has a wide, flat skull, and large eyes which seem to avoid making eye contact with us. Perhaps a side effect of the communication system.[BR][BR]It murmurs at us for a time in a language devoid of sharp consonant sounds, but no meaning really comes through. We'll have to converse with this strange creature another time.[BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_MAIN_Option265_0
StringTable.String: A being in much the same shape as a crustacean wobbles cheerfully on our view screen, a jumble of eyes and legs. A gentle shimmer suggests the creature - and its kin working behind him - are underwater at the moment.[BR][BR]The creature clicks and snaps its claws in our direction, no doubt trying to say something. Hard to say what it could be at this point.[BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_MAIN_Option266_0
StringTable.String: A tall bipedal alien appears on screen with a distinct, ridged skull. The being has six eyes, spread widely across its face, which all pivot to look at us.[BR][BR]Has it seen our kind before, or are we as much of a mystery to them as they are to us? It says something, quick and repetitive, almost a chant. A ritual greeting perhaps? But there's no making sense of it.[BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_MAIN_Option267_0
StringTable.String: An alien appears on the view screen, likely bipedal, with a long, narrow skull and slender tendrils appearing from the mouth area.[BR][BR]Small eyes towards the top of the skull narrow as it says something. The tone of the language suggests a question, though we can't understand it. The alien sways gently, sensing the futility of further communication.[BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_MAIN_Option268_0
StringTable.String: A strange bipedal alien appears on screen, with lizard-like, even draconid qualities. The crested ridges above its eyes flex, as it leans in to study us from its perch in an ornate looking room.[BR][BR]A deep growling voice emerges from somewhere deep within it, the mouth barely moving. A pleasant greeting or dire threat, we can't be sure.[BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_MAIN_Option269_0
StringTable.String: A gray skinned hominoid alien peers back at us from the view screen. The alien has four eyes, and a thin smile which gives the impression of friendliness, though that may be a dangerous assumption.[BR][BR]Behind the creature, a clean, even sterile looking spaceship can be seen. Some words are exchanged, but nothing can be understood between you and them. The thin smile remains though. All in good time, it would seem.[BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_MAIN_Option270_0
StringTable.String: A tall hominoid alien appraises us from the view screen. Although bipedal, the segmented section of its neck suggests perhaps an annelid biology.[BR][BR]Whatever its origin, the being tries a few words in its native tongue, a strange combination of rumbles and rhythmic vibrations, though nothing can be understood from it. The alien seems bemused by our speech as well.[BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_MAIN_Option271_0
StringTable.String: A strange plantlike creature appears on screen. Bark like skin covers its trunk and surprisingly humanoid looking face, before giving way to sleek, well maintained foliage further up.[BR][BR]In the background, a decidedly organic, plant-like ship can be seen. The creature emits a series of long, creaking groans, evidently trying to communicate with us. No sense can be made of it, for now.[BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_MAIN_Option272_0
StringTable.String: A glimmering creature appears on the screen, its body formed of blue crystal with wide intelligent eyes. As beautiful as it is, your awe at seeing it is not reflected in its face, which instead looks sympathetic or disgusted.[BR][BR]There is a brief pause as the creature considers you and you almost hear voices, like memories echoing distantly in your mind. But you cannot tell what they say, or if they are coming from the alien. Disappointed the creature hums softly in almost musical tones. It is beautiful, but equally indecipherable. [BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)

StringTable.Label: FIRST_CONTACT_MAIN_Option273_0
StringTable.String: The incoming message comes with the visage of a slender alien covered naturally in fuzz and chitin. Large compound eyes blink quickly and frequently.[BR][BR]A series of melodic hissing clicks comes from the being. After a short pause, another series of sounds come through the speakers, coupled with soft hand motions. Without a means to decipher the message, proper communication is unachievable.[BR][BR](You need to research Universal Translator)

StringTable.Label: LASTNAME_Option2_0
StringTable.String: Inspecio

StringTable.Label: LASTNAME_Option2_1
StringTable.String: Intuerio

StringTable.Label: LASTNAME_Option2_2
StringTable.String: Cognoscerio

StringTable.Label: LASTNAME_Option2_3
StringTable.String: Cerneriet

StringTable.Label: LASTNAME_Option2_4
StringTable.String: Videret

StringTable.Label: LASTNAME_Option2_5
StringTable.String: Oculiet

StringTable.Label: LASTNAME_Option2_6
StringTable.String: Adspicerio

StringTable.Label: LASTNAME_Option2_7
StringTable.String: Adspiceriet

StringTable.Label: LASTNAME_Option2_8
StringTable.String: Invisiliet

StringTable.Label: FIRSTNAME_Option2_0
StringTable.String: Obversius

StringTable.Label: FIRSTNAME_Option2_1
StringTable.String: Caluspex

StringTable.Label: FIRSTNAME_Option2_2
StringTable.String: Aspecius

StringTable.Label: FIRSTNAME_Option2_3

StringTable.Label: SHIPYARDADVISOR_DEFAULT_Option0_0
StringTable.String: "We have no pressing ship construction needs right now."

StringTable.Label: SHIPYARDADVISOR_MILITARY_FOR_WAR_Option0_0
StringTable.String: "We should construct more military ships to aid in our war efforts."

StringTable.Label: SHIPYARDADVISOR_WEAK_MILITARY_Option0_0
StringTable.String: "Our military is weak. We should increase military ship production so we do not appear to be easy targets."

StringTable.Label: SHIPYARDADVISOR_WEAK_COLONY_DEFENSE_Option0_0
StringTable.String: "Our colonies could use more protection from stationed ships."

StringTable.Label: SHIPYARDADVISOR_COLONIZABLE_WORLDS_Option0_0
StringTable.String: "We should build colony ships to claim additional worlds into our civilization."

StringTable.Label: SHIPYARDADVISOR_EXPLORATION_Option0_0
StringTable.String: "Much of the galaxy remains a mystery to us. We should build some probes to learn about our surroundings."

StringTable.Label: SHIPYARDADVISOR_SURVEY_Option0_0
StringTable.String: "There are anomalies we could be surveying, if we had more survey ships at our disposal."

StringTable.Label: SHIPYARDADVISOR_STARBASES_Option0_0
StringTable.String: "We should build more constructor ships, so that we can use starbases to expand our control."

StringTable.Label: RandomLore_Civ_NewsDescription_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Newly discovered records reveal the Navigators' desperate attempt to halt the Drengin's rapid growth by concealing subspace stream entrances, shedding light on the past struggle for galactic stability and the race to develop countermeasures against this formidable threat.

StringTable.Label: RandomLore_Planet_NewsDescription_Option0_0
StringTable.String: The once-prominent Thalan Empire has mysteriously vanished from the galactic scene after nearly a century of influence, leaving the interstellar community puzzled and searching for answers to their sudden disappearance.

StringTable.Label: LuxarDominion_Warning_CosmicContaminant_Option0_0
StringTable.String: The Luxar Dominion continues to warn the galactic community against a group they've termed the Cosmic Contaminant. The Dominion describes an organized group of hostile and rapidly changing organisms that thrive in radiation.

StringTable.Label: Korath_Declaration_TrueInheritors_Option0_0
StringTable.String: The Korath Clan has declared themselves the true inheritors of the Drengin Empire. While serving as the Drengin Empire's shock troopers, the Korath became renowned for vicious and ruthless behavior. They've publicly vowed to wipe out all lives.

StringTable.Label: Manti_SemiVoluntarySurveys_Option0_0
StringTable.String: The Manti have begun conducting semi-voluntary surveys. They hope through these surveys to gain a lead on their stolen spawn. Most have found these surveys unintrusive, even if a little rude.

StringTable.Label: MimotBrotherhood_BlackMarketSales_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Black market sales of Mimot-based meals are on the rise. In a public statement, the Mimot Brotherhood condemns buyers and sellers alike.

StringTable.Label: Archaeological_Discovery_FestronHiveNetworks_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Recent surveys have uncovered vast ancient hive networks on several dead worlds. Their resemblance to modern Festron hives is uncanny, leading many to believe that the Festron had a way to traverse space before modern space travel.

StringTable.Label: KrynnSyndicate_ReligiousCensusReport_Option0_0
StringTable.String: The Krynn Syndicate has released its bi-annual religious census report. The report indicates that most conscious life follows The Way. Many independent organizations have already questioned the authenticity of this census report.

StringTable.Label: TerranResistance_DocumentaryRumors_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Rumors indicate that the Terran Resistance is working closely with a galaxy-renowned documentarian to tell their origin story. The documentary is said to paint the Terran Alliance in a poor light. The Alliance has made no public comment in response to the rumors.

StringTable.Label: IntueriAggregate_TechnologicalCompetition_Option0_0
StringTable.String: The Intueri Aggregate attempted to hold its first 'Wonders of Technological Development' competition this week. None attended.

StringTable.Label: Xeloxi_CalmDemeanor_Option0_0
StringTable.String: The Xeloxi are great, and their calm demeanor is an envy to all. It's reported that the Xeloxi are not holding any GNN staff hostage. This "report" is currently unconfirmed.

StringTable.Label: DrenginEmpire_KorathClanRelations_Option0_0
StringTable.String: When asked about their relationships with the Korath Clan, a representative of the Drengin Empire threw a GNN correspondent through a window.

StringTable.Label: TorianHeritage_MemorialAnnouncement_Option0_0
StringTable.String: A heritage organization within the Torian Regime has announced the intent to start a memorial to the Torian's turbulent history and those lost in brutal conditions. Donations from all are welcome.

StringTable.Label: DrathFreehold_AllegationsAgainstAltarians_Option0_0
StringTable.String: The Drath Freehold claims that a recent report published by Altarian historians blatantly ignores obvious facts that prove the Drath originated from Altar. As of yet, no independent review has supported this claim.

StringTable.Label: PhalenoidsAdvance_NocturnalCycleTraditions_Option0_0
StringTable.String: A cultural group from within the Phalenoids Advance has happily shared their traditions around the Nocturnal Cycle, with celebrations occurring roughly once every 15 months. They encourage any interested to participate in their ceremonies.

StringTable.Label: WORDONTHESTREET_STARVING_Option0_0
StringTable.String: The citizens of this world are starving. We desperately need more farmers or to colonize fertile words to feed our empire.

StringTable.Label: WORDONTHESTREET_OVERCROWDED_Option0_0
StringTable.String: This world's population is booming. Some complain about overcrowding, but that's just a result of our amazing world.

StringTable.Label: WORDONTHESTREET_POPULATIONCAP_Option0_0
StringTable.String: There is a housing crisis on here. We need to build Housing Districts or transport people to other worlds.

StringTable.Label: WORDONTHESTREET_LOWRESISTANCE_Option0_0
StringTable.String: This world is the envy of our allies and enemies alike. But without defenses how can we protect it?

StringTable.Label: WORDONTHESTREET_PROTESTING_Option0_0
StringTable.String: I have done everything, but the citizens of this planet are rioting. We need support from our government to ease their concerns.

StringTable.Label: WORDONTHESTREET_PLANETNOTDEFENDED_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Without any ships in orbit how do we hope to protect it from attack?

StringTable.Label: WORDONTHESTREET_HIGHALIENCULTURE_Option0_0
StringTable.String: The citizens of this world have embraced a foreign way of life. Few feel any connection to our civilization.

StringTable.Label: WORDONTHESTREET_INDEBT_Option0_0
StringTable.String: We must must constrain our spending. The citizens of of this planet are already hoarding supplies.

StringTable.Label: WORDONTHESTREET_NEEDWEALTHIMPROVEMENT_Option0_0
StringTable.String: This planet is full of economic opportunity. We should build more wealth improvements here to take advantage of it.

StringTable.Label: WORDONTHESTREET_NEEDENTREPRENEUR_Option0_0
StringTable.String: This planet is rich with economic resources, but we don't have any entrepreneurs here to take advantage of it.

StringTable.Label: WORDONTHESTREET_NEEDRESEARCHIMPROVEMENT_Option0_0
StringTable.String: This planet is full of technological marvels. We should build more research improvements here to take advantage of it.

StringTable.Label: WORDONTHESTREET_NEEDSCIENTIST_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Without any scientists the technological wonders of This planet are being wasted.

StringTable.Label: WORDONTHESTREET_HIGHCRIME_Option0_0
StringTable.String: High crime on this planet makes many of our citizens afraid to walk our streets. Our poorest citizens are the most directly effected, but corruption among our wealthy is equally rampant.

StringTable.Label: WORDONTHESTREET_HIGHCRIME_Option1_0
StringTable.String: There is a great deal of disorder on this planet.

StringTable.Label: WORDONTHESTREET_HIGHPOLLUTION_Option0_0
StringTable.String: We celebrated planetfall day but no one could see the fireworks through the haze of pollution. We must clean this planet up if we want people to live here.

StringTable.Label: WORDONTHESTREET_HIGHPOLLUTION_Option1_0
StringTable.String: The pollution on this world is high and we love it.

StringTable.Label: WORDONTHESTREET_HIGHPOLLUTION_Option2_0
StringTable.String: The hive having trouble with all the pollution.

StringTable.Label: WORDONTHESTREET_HIGHMORALE_Option0_0
StringTable.String: The citizens of this world are among the most loyal and happy in the galaxy. Due, in no small part, to my excellent leadership.

StringTable.Label: WORDONTHESTREET_HIGHMORALE_Option1_0
StringTable.String: The contaminates are moving with ease.

StringTable.Label: WORDONTHESTREET_HIGHMORALE_Option2_0
StringTable.String: The hive is pleased.

StringTable.Label: WORDONTHESTREET_LOWMORALE_Option0_0
StringTable.String: I have done as much as I can for the citizens here. We need real change before things get worse.

StringTable.Label: WORDONTHESTREET_LOWMORALE_Option1_0
StringTable.String: The contaminates are not glowing as they should.

StringTable.Label: WORDONTHESTREET_LOWMORALE_Option2_0
StringTable.String: The hive is brimming in rage.

StringTable.Label: WORDONTHESTREET_MIDMORALE_Option0_0
StringTable.String: The citizens of this world seem happy. There are always some complainers but I wouldn't worry about it.

StringTable.Label: WORDONTHESTREET_MIDMORALE_Option1_0
StringTable.String: The glow of the contaminates seems adequate.

StringTable.Label: WORDONTHESTREET_MIDMORALE_Option2_0
StringTable.String: The hive is hungry but content.

StringTable.Label: WORDONTHESTREET_HIGHTAXES_Option0_0
StringTable.String: The citizens of this planet can no longer bear our high taxes. Please lower taxes and provide them relief.

StringTable.Label: WORDONTHESTREET_HIGHTAXES_Option1_0
StringTable.String: The hive is displeased with having to transfer so much to the central authority.

StringTable.Label: WORDONTHESTREET_POLICESTATE_Option0_0
StringTable.String: The citizens of this planet call for us to enact the Police State policy. And those that don't call for it are probably useless criminals.

StringTable.Label: WORDONTHESTREET_YOUAREJUSTANUMBER_Option0_0
StringTable.String: A dangerous trend of self-expression and lack of conformity has taken root here. We should enact the You Are Just A Number policy and get people back to their useful repetitive work.

StringTable.Label: WORDONTHESTREET_GUNRIGHTS_Option0_0
StringTable.String: Freedom is critical to the people here. We should enact the Gun Market policy and allow our citizens to buy and sell any weapons they want.

StringTable.Label: WORDONTHESTREET_UNIVERSALHEALTHCRE_Option0_0
StringTable.String: The citizens here can't receive adequate medical care. We should enact the Universal Health Care policy and show them that our government serves its citizens, no the other way around.

StringTable.Label: WORDONTHESTREET_NEEDSHIPYARD_Option0_0
StringTable.String: This world needs a shipyard!

StringTable.String: Angela
